item.title: [EJS-285] Improve consumption of Error reported by text-processor
item.description:
As ITN, I want to report error that include the scrid so the logs are more easily searchable.

The text-processor already reporting like this - this is what caused EJS-277. This story is to update the code & doc to consume the error sent by text-processor.

The current specification state this format:
INIT_ERROR <Code> <Description>

The code and the specification document must be updated to reflect this format:
ITN_ERROR <scrid> <Code> <Description>

  • <scrid>is any text.
  • <Code> is numeric
  • <description> is optional.

The specification document is here:
http://inside.nuance.com/mobility/Eng/NGV2T/Shared%20Documents/Next%20Gen%20V2T%20(VMCS)/Analysis%20and%20Design/Text-Processor%20-%20Specs.docx

Modification required to the doc:

  • Add a revision at the beginning
  • Change the description of ITN_ERROR during the request sequence
  • No changes in the initialization sequence (pending Daniel response)
item.summary: Improve consumption of Error reported by text-processor

comments.comment:
Following RPMs contain a fix for this issue:

sv-java-ejectorservice-201412151624-2.7.0.1.166315.noarch.rpm
sv-java-ejectorservice-etc-201412151624-2.7.0.1.166315.noarch.rpm

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
AC1: ITN_ERROR must have the following format
ITN_ERROR <scrid> <Code> <Description>
where:
<scrid>is any text.
<Code> is numeric
<description> is optional.

AC2. If description is missing, application should not throw any error and handle it properly.

AC3: If code is not numeric, application should throw IllegalStateException and text-processor should be returned back to pool (EJS-277)

item.title: [EJS-283] Only perform ITN on messages seen by human agent(s)
item.description:
As Nuance, I want to only run EJS ITN on message that have seen an agent so I won't waste resource on performing ITN on already ITN messages.

A simple way to tell if an a message has seen an agent or not is to look at the "ScoringMetadata.transcriberName" which is the last agent that see the message. If it is "Grid", it means no agent saw the message and ITN is not required.

So for extra flexibility, a new property is required:

<itn-message-master-selector>All | AllAssured | AllHuman | None</itn-message-master-selector>

All : As before this task (all messages for which language/profile is supported)
Assured: Only class of service assured message (for which language/profile is supported)
Human: Only message where transcriber name is NOT Grid (for which language/profile is supported)
None: No message - this replace the "enabled" property (equivalent to false)
item.summary: Only perform ITN on messages seen by human agent(s)

status.description: Agile Story ready for QA

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
AC1: If itn-message-master-selector property is not defined, EJS will not start and log an error.

AC2: itn-message-master-selector can have following possible values (case-insenstive):
All : As before this task (all messages for which language/profile is supported)
Assured: Only class of service assured message (for which language/profile is supported)
Human: Only message where transcriber name is NOT Grid (for which language/profile is supported)
None: No message - this replace the "enabled" property (equivalent to false)

AC3: text-processor.enabled property is no longer required. This property will not be delivered in ejector-service.xml file in new build.

AC4: If itn-message-master-selector is set as All, EJS will perform as usual i.e. send messages for ITN (all messages for which language/profile is supported)

AC5: If itn-message-master-selector is set as Assured, EJS will send only messages for ITN for which class of service is assured(for which language/profile is supported)

AC6: If itn-message-master-selector is set as Human, EJS will check ScoringMetadata.transcriberName to determine if a agent saw the message or not. If this value is set as "Grid", it means no agent saw the message and ITN is not required.

AC7: If itn-message-master-selector is set as None, EJS will not send any messages for ITN. This property replaces text-processor.enabled property.

item.title: [EJS-271] Delete from Cluster SM even when Sumbit to USS fails
item.description: We need to have the "delete from cluster SM" task being executed even when we fail to go to USS (take too long or thread queue is full).

sv-java-nsca2trap-raw-etc-201308051510-2.6.7.57.28.x86_64

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
AC1: Given a scoring task fails to be added to the Scoring Task Queue or Retention Task Queue:

  1. EJS should raise an alarm the first time it occurs, and:
  2. There must be an error log Failed to en-queued task %s for asynchronous execution: %s.

AC2: Given a scoring task fails to be added to the Scoring Task Queue:

  1. EJS should still attempt to queue the DeletionTask to the Retention Task Queue.

AC2: For the first task that is successfully en-queued to the Scoring Task Queue or the Retention Task Queue after EJS started and after a task was previously rejected by the queue:

  1. EJS should raise an OK alarm.

AC3: Given a valid ejector config, parameters can control default behaviour for Scoring Task Queue and Retention Task Queue:

  1. Control the size of the thread pools with alternate-thread-pool-size property, and:
  2. Control the size of the queues with alternate-thread-pool-queue-size property, and:
  3. Control the level of the alert (CRITICAL vs WARNING) sent when the queue is full with alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical property.

    /etc/nuance/ejector-service/ejector-service.xml

    		 
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    		 
    <ejector-config>
    		 
      <workflow>
    		 
        <alternate-thread-pool-size>20</alternate-thread-pool-size>
    		 
        <alternate-thread-pool-queue-size>100</alternate-thread-pool-queue-size>
    		 
        <alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical>true</alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical>
    		 
    	...
    		 
      </workflow>
    		 
      ...
    		 
    <ejector-config>

AC4: Given a valid ejector config, parameters can control behaviour of Scoring Task Queue:

  1. Control the size of the thread pool with alternate-thread-pool-size property, and:
  2. Control the size of the queue with alternate-thread-pool-queue-size property, and:
  3. Control the level of the alert (CRITICAL vs WARNING) sent when the queue is full with alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical property.

    /etc/nuance/ejector-service/ejector-service.xml

    		 
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    		 
    <ejector-config>
    		 
      <workflow>
    		 
        <scoring>
    		 
          <alternate-thread-pool-size>20</alternate-thread-pool-size>
    		 
          <alternate-thread-pool-queue-size>100</alternate-thread-pool-queue-size>
    		 
          <alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical>true</alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical>
    		 
        </scoring>
    		 
    	...
    		 
      </workflow>
    		 
      ...
    		 
    <ejector-config>

AC5: Given a valid ejector config, parameters can control behaviour of Retention Task Queue:

  1. Control the size of the thread pool with alternate-thread-pool-size property, and:
  2. Control the size of the queue with alternate-thread-pool-queue-size property, and:
  3. Control the level of the alert (CRITICAL vs WARNING) sent when the queue is full with alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical property.

    /etc/nuance/ejector-service/ejector-service.xml

    		 
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    		 
    <ejector-config>
    		 
      <workflow>
    		 
        <retention>
    		 
          <alternate-thread-pool-size>20</alternate-thread-pool-size>
    		 
          <alternate-thread-pool-queue-size>100</alternate-thread-pool-queue-size>
    		 
          <alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical>true</alternate-thread-pool-queue-reject-is-critical>
    		 
        </retention>
    		 
    	...
    		 
      </workflow>
    		 
      ...
    		 
    <ejector-config>

item.title: [EJS-267] Add (StateChangeAlertable) alarm when rejecting request because ${workflow.alternate-thread-pool-queue-size} is reached.
item.description:
As NOC, I want to receive an OK/Critical alarm when request cannot be submitted to USS and have files deleted from cluster SM so I can be aware of the health of the system.

When an alternate workflow threat pool and its queue are full, we need to raise a critical alarm. We need to send an OK alarm when we successfully submit a request in that thread pool.

workflow.alternate-thread-pool-size
workflow.alternate-thread-pool-queue-size

Th alarm catalog / wiki needs to be updated as well.

SVN location of th catalog :

  • https://mobi-v2t-svn.nuance.com/svn/Engineering/voicemail-to-text/server/alert-documentation/trunk
  • We don't create branch for the project
  • We need to update the version to have RPM properly named.

Wiki location to add description:

  • https://svwiki.nuance.com/wiki/pmwiki.php/Alerts/Ejector

Jenkins Build here:

  • https://mobi-v2t-jenkins.nuance.com:8443/view/All/job/build_voice-message-conversion-system__alert-documentation_application/
    Attachments
item.summary: Add (StateChangeAlertable) alarm when rejecting request because ${workflow.alternate-thread-pool-queue-size} is reached.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The assumtions (2) in the acceptance criteria needs to be updated as follows:

A request keeps a thread busy the time it :

Submit a request to USS (that clones files)----> EJS send a request to USS for scoring and not for cloning Uss then after scoring send a request to SM for clonning or archiving a message
Delete files from cluster SB ---> should be SM

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Given that:

  1. total capacity is & {workflow.alternate-thread-pool-size}

    + $

    {workflow.alternate-thread-pool-queue-size}
  2. A request keeps a thread busy the time it :
    1. send a request to USS for scoring
    2. Delete files from cluster SM.

AC1: The first time capacity goes from non-exceeded to exceeded, a CRITICAL alarm is sent to Zenoss
AC2: The first time the capacity goes from exceeded to non-exceeded, an OK alarm is raised,
AC3: Everytime capacity is exceeded, this error is added to the logs:

ERROR com.nuance.workflow.WorkflowManager -  Failed to en-queue task SUBMIT_FOR_SCORING for asynchronous execution : Task com.nuance.workflow.WorkflowManager$2@549cd6e5 rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@19449aae[Running, pool size = 20, active threads = 20, queued tasks = 20, completed tasks = 2688006]

item.title: [EJS-258] [Performance] - The EJS bottleneck is currently in the amount of connection allowed (USS/GRS)
item.description:
The performance bottleneck was found while troubleshooting the issue EJS-221.

With a 100ms ACK delay from USS,SM,DPM and GRS nodes, EJS starts choking quite fast on SM/USS calls. (~19 TPS)

static int DEFAULT_MAX_HOST_CONNECTIONS (The default maximum number of connections allowed per host - Default: 2)
static int DEFAULT_MAX_TOTAL_CONNECTIONS(The default maximum number of connections allowed overall - Default: 20)

In order to find the next bottleneck in EJS and hopefully reach a 100% CPU, those value should be configurable.

See EJS-221 for the details of the troubleshooting and screenshot of JMC threads status.

Acceptance Criteria

AC-1: As a deployment engineer I want to be able to configured the maximum amount of connection EJS is allowed PER HOST in order to allow more message per minutes to be handled
AC-2: As a deployment engineer I want to be able to configured the maximum amount of TOTAL connection EJS is allowed in order to allow more message per minutes to be handled
item.summary: [Performance] - The EJS bottleneck is currently in the amount of connection allowed (USS/GRS)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
similar SM configuration asdded ad part of EJS-230 needs to be added to USS and GRS

(ejector-config/storage-manager/max-XXX-connections)

Since the DPM is phasing out, it can be ignored for that.

item.title: [EJS-254] Revert back the change made for EJS-152
item.description:
During the deployment of LC13.1 in production in week of 08/18, an issue occurred and the solution would be to revert back the fix we made in EJS-152
This request comes from Lisa and Eli

The objective is for EJS to send the Post-ITN/Pre-PP text to USS.
item.summary: Revert back the change made for EJS-152

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The current order is: 1. PP; 2. ITN.
Does this mean we have to change the order of the text processing?

EJS-152 changes occur before ejecting to EPS/GRS).
Do we have to revert the change when ejecting to EPS/GRS?

I am not sure to understand...

Isn't ITN the post-processing?
How can we trigger post-processing to change the text to ensure we persist it? (We know how ITN works but not post-processing)
Where is the text should be persisted? In both DPM and USS?

Question:
1) So after this is story is done... all altered text by Post-Processing are not sent to USS?

I confirmed with Lisa.

  • Pre-EJS-152 the "convertedText" sent to USS was ITN, but not PP - The text of the Message object was altered by EJS (original text from grid and/or agent was replaced by the ITN version of the text)
  • Post-EJS-152, the original text is sent to USS as converted text - this is the problem.

So in EJS, the ITN/PP opetation cannot be considered as a single operation as it is right not in the CompositeTextProcessor. We need to apply ITN on the original text, an replace the convertedText with it (that what goes to USS). Then, we apply PP and the ITN/PP text goes back to customer and set as "postProcessedText" (see note below)

Note: from 2.6.10.1, EJS also the the ITN and PP text to USS, but under the "postProcecessedText" metadata. This is not used by scorer and will go archive in NRG in metadata file.
Debug logs for package com.nuance.mobility.v2t.ejector.textprocessor can be enabled for text processing validation.

Path to automated test cases:

ProjectVmcs.ClusterComponents.EjectorService.SuiteInvertedTextNormalization.SuiteValidateItnTraffic.SuiteValidateRequestErrors.ValidateInvalidMessage.ValidateMessageWithBlankConvertedText

ProjectVmcs.ClusterComponents.EjectorService.SuiteInvertedTextNormalization.SuiteValidateItnTraffic.SuiteValidateRequestErrors.ValidateInvalidMessage.ValidateMessageWithBlankConvertedText

Tested on build:

sv-java-ejectorservice-201408280033-2.6.10.2.161369.noarch
sv-java-ejectorservice-etc-201408280033-2.6.10.2.161369.noarch
Customer Integration Tested ran successfully on stage

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
AC1 - Message convertedText should be ITN text.
AC2 - Message postProcessedText should be ITN+PostProcessed text.
AC3 - Empty text should go through without post-processing and errors.

item.summary: EJS Support for new ITN languages and enable ITn for additional customer profile

item.title: [EJS-240] [common-audit] Rollover the previous audit file
item.description:
This story is about modifying the common-audit library and then use it in EJS.

Adding a version part to the base audit file name introduce a new problem: whenever the base file name changes in an software/configuration upgrade(ex: from v1.0 to v1.1), the "old current file" is not reused or rollover when the new version of the software/configuration is restarted.

Example:

  • A configuration change updates ejector-config/audit/filename from "ejector-audit-v1.0.csv" to "ejector-audit-v1.1.csv".
  • The application is stopped at 12h15 and restarted at 12h45, after the upfrafe om 07/29/2014
  • When the application is stopped to apply this upgrade, the current audit is "ejector-audit-v1.0.csv"
  • When the application is restarted, new audit is "ejector-audit-v1.1.csv"
  • old audit "ejector-audit-v1.0.csv" will contains message processed between 12h00 and 12h15.
  • new audit "ejector-audit-v1.1.csv" will contains message processed between 12h45 and 12h59.
  • At 13h00, ejector-audit-v1.1.csv will rollover and be renamed ejector-audit-v1.1.csv.2014-07-29-12
  • The problem: "ejector-audit-v1.0.csv" will never rollover and consequently never be sent to BID.

This story is about adding a new audit configuration item: previous-filename.

At startup, common-audit should look at any existing $

{previous-filename}

. If the file exist, and appropriate roollover extension needs to be added. This should be completely independent of the handling of $the current audit file ($

{filemane}

).
item.summary: [common-audit] Rollover the previous audit file

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
IMO, we should use a pattern to match log file names or have a list instead of a single previous filename value to support different upgrade paths. Also this makes for a one-time configuration that we don't have to update overtime.

I don't think we need a roll over frequency limitation. Why have a different behavior? IMO it just makes it more complicated to understand/support.

Proposal:
1. Configuration includes a log file pattern (ex.: ejector-audit-v(\d+(.\d+)+).csv
2. At startup, the configured log filename is validated against the pattern. If it does not match, the application fails to start
3. At startup, if a file matches the pattern and has a different name than the current log filename. The log4j "datePattern" should be used when appending timestamps.
3.1 file is empty: append current timestamp to the filename
3.2 file is not empty: append last line timestamp to the filename

Adding the following config to ejector-service.xml:
<previous-audit>
<directory>/var/log/spinvox/ejector-service/</directory>
</previous-audit>

Optionally the configuration can be added to specify the pattern to find previous audit files; here is the default value:
<previous-audit>
<filename-path-matcher>regex:ejector-audit-v(\d+(\.\d+)*)\.csv</filename-path-matcher>
<directory>/var/log/spinvox/ejector-service/</directory>
</previous-audit>

Since the current audit roll over used the audit file last modified date, the logic is used from previous audit files that needs to be rolled over. i.e. whether the previous audit file is empty or not the last modified date is used for the timestamp extension.

Path to the automated test cases:

ProjectVmcs.ClusterComponents.EjectorService.FunctionalTest.Suite02EjectorAuditFunctionalTest.SuiteValidateAuditUpgrade

Tested on build:

sv-java-ejectorservice-201408280033-2.6.10.2.161369.noarch
sv-java-ejectorservice-etc-201408280033-2.6.10.2.161369.noarch

Montreal ILT

EJS rollover audit files
rw-r---- 1 ejector ejector 192957 Sep 9 15:59 audit-ejector-service-v1.1.csv.2014-09-09-15
rw-r---- 1 ejector ejector 637 Sep 4 17:37 ejector-audit-v1.0.csv.2014-09-04-17

[root@mtl-blade10-11 audit]# rpm -qa|grep ejector
sv-java-ejectorservice-etc-201409031015-2.6.10.2.161699.noarch
sv-java-ejectorservice-201409031015-2.6.10.2.161699.noarch

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Let:
$

{audit.filename}

being the current audit file
$

{audit.filename-pattern} as the previous or current audit file name format.
${audit.directory} the audit directory as configured. It is the assume location of ${filename} and ${audit.filename-pattern}

.
$

{audit.rollover-frequency}

is the configured rollover frequency. One of daily, hourly, minutely

AC1: if $

{audit.filename-pattern} do not match any file, nothing happens.
AC2: if ${audit.filename-pattern}

matches old audit file(s), the file(s) need to be rename with a rollover extension.
AC5: When an previous audit file needs to rollover, the extension need to corresponds to the last modification time of the audit file.

item.title: [EJS-238] [Text Processor][Refactoring] Do not throw LanguageNotSupportedException
item.description:
Currently, if ITN is requested for a language that is not supported a LanguageNotSupportedException is thrown and is it is the responsibility of the calling application (EJS) to handle it. EJS used to log an error and raise an alarm.

However, this situation is "normal" because it cannot be avoided: a given supported profile, will send message in multiple languages. Some of them will be supported, some of them won't.

The short them solution to the error and alarm flood was in EJS ItnTextProcessor class. We changed the error log + alarm to a simple debug log (similar is a request for unsupported profile) See svn revision 159501 for details.

This is not a good long term solution as throwing exception at high frequency affects performance. It would be preferable to be coherent with the way request from unsupported profiles are handled. So the request re factoring is about:

  • Make the TextProcessorRequestSelector aware of the supported language the same was it know about supported profile.
  • TextProcessorRequestSelector.isSelected should return false when the language of the request is not supported.
  • The debug log in TextProcessorRequestSelector should be reason-specific (either unsupported profile or language)
  • Remove the LanguageNotSupportedException exception and its handling in ItnTextProcessor
item.summary: [Text Processor][Refactoring] Do not throw LanguageNotSupportedException

item.title: [EJS-234] EJS->USS: distinct connect & read timout
item.description:
Cutrently, the timeout value to sumbit to USS is set to 30 seconds. This value is used for both connect and read timeout. This value is adequate for the read timeout (USS needs to clone files from cluster). However, this value is way to high for connect timeout.

This story is to have two distinct value in EJS configuration.

Now:

<unified-scoring>
...
<timeout>30000</timeout>
...
</unified-scoring>

Needed:

<unified-scoring>
...
<connect-timeout-milliseconds>1000</connect-timeout-milliseconds>
<read-timeout-milliseconds>30000</read-timeout-milliseconds>
...
</unified-scoring>
item.summary: EJS->USS: distinct connect & read timout

item.title: [EJS-232] [Startup] - The startup time of EJS when configured with many ITN languages on a single proc takes longer then hardcoded 2 minutes allowed in daemon script
item.description:
The ejectorservice daemon script uses the mobility-shell-scripts package to start its java service. This script has an hardcoded value of 120 seconds before returning failing on "Service Interface Check".

##########################

      1. Service Interface Check
        ##########################
  2. Returns 0 if the HTTP service is ready is running until process with PID $1 is running.
    function checkServiceIsReadyWithRetries {
    local pid="$1"
    local retries=120
    for ((i=0; i<retries; i++)); do
    echo -n "."
    $SERVICE_CHECK_COMMAND > /dev/null
    if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then return 0; fi
    checkProcessIsRunning $pid;
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then return 1; fi
    sleep 1s
    done
    return 1;

Due to the long list of languages 1 ITN processor may support in EJS, this value is too small. To load the entire list of 37 languages on one processor it takes between 4-5 minutes to fully start.
item.summary: [Startup] - The startup time of EJS when configured with many ITN languages on a single proc takes longer then hardcoded 2 minutes allowed in daemon script

item.title: [EJS-231] [Performance] - EJS shall allow to monitor component integration's performance over JMX
item.description:
As a quality analyst, I want to be able to monitor the time a request to an external component takes so that I can assess performance metrics for each integration point.

AC-1: The metrics shall be accessible via JMX
AC-2: As a JMC (Java Mission Control) user, I shall be able to consult the DPM call duration's statistics
AC-3: As a JMC (Java Mission Control) user, I shall be able to consult the GRS call duration's statistics
AC-4: As a JMC (Java Mission Control) user, I shall be able to consult the SM call duration's statistics
AC-5: As a JMC (Java Mission Control) user, I shall be able to consult the USS call duration's statistics
AC-6: As a JMC (Java Mission Control) user, I shall be able to consult the overall system connection's statistics
item.summary: [Performance] - EJS shall allow to monitor component integration's performance over JMX

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [EJS-230] [Performance] - The EJS bottleneck is currently in the amount of connection allowed for SM
item.description:
The performance bottleneck was found while troubleshooting the issue EJS-221.

With a 100ms ACK delay from USS,SM,DPM and GRS nodes, EJS starts choking quite fast on SM/USS calls. (~19 TPS)

static int DEFAULT_MAX_HOST_CONNECTIONS (The default maximum number of connections allowed per host - Default: 2)
static int DEFAULT_MAX_TOTAL_CONNECTIONS(The default maximum number of connections allowed overall - Default: 20)

In order to find the next bottleneck in EJS and hopefully reach a 100% CPU, those value should be configurable.

See EJS-221 for the details of the troubleshooting and screenshot of JMC threads status.

Acceptance Criteria

AC-1: As a deployment engineer I want to be able to configured the maximum amount of connection EJS is allowed PER HOST in order to allow more message per minutes to be handled
AC-2: As a deployment engineer I want to be able to configured the maximum amount of TOTAL connection EJS is allowed in order to allow more message per minutes to be handled
item.summary: [Performance] - The EJS bottleneck is currently in the amount of connection allowed for SM

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [EJS-215] common-audit: rollover at start-up
item.description:
At start-up of the application, this is the current behaviour:

When the application starts: At reception of 1st V2T msg:

  • Creates a CURRENT if it does not exist
  • If CURRENT exist and does not corresponds to the current hour :
  • Add the appropriate timestamp extension to CURRENT so it becomes part of PREVIOUS set
  • A new CURRENT is created.

We need the exact same thing to happen, but at startup, without waiting for the first message to arrive.

Note: once complete, create a story against each of GA, GM, AA, TEP & USS to have their version of common-audit updated.
Note: This shoud be combined with EJS-214
item.summary: common-audit: rollover at start-up

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [EJS-214] Update common-audit: too many Quartz threads
item.description:
common-audit uses Quartz scheduling to preform audit rollover. The threadpool to run the (houly) logs rollover contains 10 thread wher 1 will be enough.

Also, there ai "new version check" that hapen at startup andd it should be disabled:

item.title: [EJS-211] ITN baseline provisioning Guidelines
item.description:
This activity is also called ITN breaking limits. The objective of this story is to determine in a component environment the the ITN breaking limit as a function of the number of ITN processes, the number of languages each ITN process is handling. In order keep the numbers realistic it has been decided that the ITN worst case scenario should be selected (es-co as feedback from research)and that although the number of languages should vary, this worst case will always be duplicated.

Testing will be done on EJS: 2.6.8.49 + text processor: 2.6.8.50
es-co will be renamed to simulate other languages to keep the test model straight forward.

Note: depending on the results we may want to vary the timeout.
Text must be equivalent to a text for a 22 second voice mail.

Initial thoughts on Limits:
For one language, number of ITN processes vary: 1, 6, 12
For one ITN process, number of languages vary: 1, 4, 8, 16, 34

Measurements:
Memory footprint
Boot time
CPU utilization
Highest traffic rate where less than 0.01% of the traffic times out waiting for ITN response.
item.summary: ITN baseline provisioning Guidelines

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
AC-1: The CLT completion shall indicates the scalability of ITN process
AC-2: The CLT completion shall indicates the impact of supporting more then one language per processor

item.title: [EJS-195] [ITN] Add new languages and increment the number of Text Proocessor
item.description:
LC13 introduced new languages for ITN: en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES and fr-CA

These new language need to be added in the ITN configuration of EJS.

Since more languiage are supported, we need 4 more Text Processor for a total of 6.

The new configuration is this one:

<instances>
<instance-1>
<supported-languages>en-US,en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES,fr-CA,en-US-dit,es-US,es-MX-lit,fr-FR</supported-languages>
</instance-1>
<instance-2>
<supported-languages>en-US,en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES,fr-CA,en-US-dit,es-US,es-MX-lit,fr-FR</supported-languages>
</instance-2>
<instance-3>
<supported-languages>en-US,en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES,fr-CA,en-US-dit,es-US,es-MX-lit,fr-FR</supported-languages>
</instance-3>
<instance-4>
<supported-languages>en-US,en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES,fr-CA,en-US-dit,es-US,es-MX-lit,fr-FR</supported-languages>
</instance-4>
<instance-5>
<supported-languages>en-US,en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES,fr-CA,en-US-dit,es-US,es-MX-lit,fr-FR</supported-languages>
</instance-5>
<instance-6>
<supported-languages>en-US,en-ZA,es-CO,es-ES,fr-CA,en-US-dit,es-US,es-MX-lit,fr-FR</supported-languages>
</instance-6>
</instances>

item.title: [EJS-177] Increase TextProcessor (ITN) initialization timeout to 60 seconds
item.description:
The current timeout value for ITN initialization it to low for the slow machine of Bracknell Legacy.

The timeout value must be increase from 30 to 60 seconds

<processor>
<data-location>/opt/nuance/text-processor/language-models</data-location>
<logging-level>INFO</logging-level>
<initialization-timeout-msecs>30000 -> 60000</initialization-timeout-msecs>
<shutdown-timeout-msecs>30000</shutdown-timeout-msecs>
</processor>
item.summary: Increase TextProcessor (ITN) initialization timeout to 60 seconds

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
In my test host (vm), i need to increase initialization-timeout-msecs from 60000 to 90000 in order to start ejs.

But Cati already has the latest nu-text processors, and itn works fine.

So Ali and I believe it is a vm issue that need longer time to startup.

item.title: [EJS-167] Create symlink to mimic the previous "spinvox" folders
item.description:
Symbolinc links will be created to have:
• /opt/spinvox/ejector --> /opt/nuance/ejector
• /etc/spinvox/ejector/config --> /etc/nuance/ejector/config

This needs to be done at RPM installation and it will mimic the previous installation directories.

Once all components will be release under "nuance", the symlink will be remove all at once and GHO will know that application are now all in "nuance" (no mixes)
item.summary: Create symlink to mimic the previous "spinvox" folders

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Release Notes update:

• Update Ejector Service rpms

Note: Update is not supported because of conflicts between directories and symbolic links.
yum remove sv-java-ejector-service sv-java-ejector-service-etc
yum install sv-java-ejector-service sv-java-ejector-service-etc

Error example if using update: ln: creating symbolic link `/var/log/spinvox/ejector-service/ejector-service' to `/var/log/nuance/ejector-service': File exists

1. Remove ejector service completely
2. Install new build
3. Start ejector service successfully
4. Symbolinc links are created to have:
• /opt/spinvox/ejector --> /opt/nuance/ejector
• /etc/spinvox/ejector/config --> /etc/nuance/ejector/config

item.title: [EJS-140] add detailed audil length information in the audit
item.description:
The EJS audit file needs to contains detailed information about audit length.

The information will be added in the Message object au part of GRD-752. This story is about adding replacing the values in the audit logs

Remove this audit
audioLengthMilliseconds

Add The following ones:

receivedAudioLengthMilliseconds

  • The length of the audio received by the customer

truncatedAudioLengthMilliseconds

  • The length of the audio received by the customer, after it has been truncated according to the profile configuration
  • truncatedAudioLengthMilliseconds <= receivedAudioLengthMilliseconds

trimmedAudioLengthMilliseconds (already exist)

  • The length of the audio after it has been truncated AND then silence removed
  • Depending on configuration or exceptional error, this value can be empty
  • trimmedAudioLengthMilliseconds <= truncatedAudioLengthMilliseconds

finalAudioLengthMilliseconds

  • The length of the audio as processed by the recognizer and by agent if applicable
  • Normally equal to the trimmedAudioLengthMilliseconds (or truncatedAudioLengthMilliseconds)
item.summary: add detailed audil length information in the audit

item.title: [EJS-114] Send the QoS Score to USS for review
item.description:
When EJS sends submits a request to USS for potential scoring, it needs to include the QoS Score. The QoS score can then be corrected by reviewer/validator.

On the USS side, the QoS score needs to be optional. Stated otherwise, it is possible for the EJS to not send a QoS score because
1) QoS not enalble for the current language
2) older version of EJS that does know about QoS (so USS is backward compatible)

item.title: [EJS-108] EJS workflow needs to be able to skip "optional" tasks if they consecutively fail beyond an acceptable limit
item.description:
Background: During a load-test, EJS starting throwing OutOfMemomry exceptions when its queue did not drain fast enough because of the submitForScoring task to USS. The root cause was because USS experienced major IO latency due to a network failure in GPFS and could not respond back to EJS in a timely manner. Consequently, EJS's queue got filled up and OOM exceptions began appearing.

The scoring request to USS can be considered "optional" and should be skipped should it cause EJS to go down causing the cluster to also go down.

Here is a list of tasks that EJS may skip:

  • submitForScoring
  • deleteFromStorageManager

Here is what need to be done:

  • Create a new class that will extend com.nuance.workflow.task.Task.
  • New class in in the common-workflow project and is com.nuance.workflow.task.OptionalTask.
  • OptionalTask will remember when failure of the task started
  • When OptionalTask fails to execute successfully for X seconds in a row, the effective task will be skipped for Y seconds.
  • During the period (Y), the real task will not be executed, but it will be transparent to the WorkflowManager because OptionalTask will return success.
  • X and Y are configured when an instance of a subclass of OptionalTask is created.

The "failing started at" value for a given task to be against X is reset in two cases:
1) Every time the effective task complete successfully
2) After the task has been bypass for Y seconds.

The two optional tasks of EJS need to be configured independently.

Default values: (if we fails continuously for 2 minutes, we skip that task for 5 minutes)
X : 180
Y : 300

EJS should send an alert (StateChangeAlertable):

  • Indicating a specific optional task will be bypass for Y seconds because it failed for X seconds in a row (CRITICAL)
  • when a specific optional task is no longer by-passed (OK)

The alarms needs to be documented properly in :
1) Alert documentation: https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/optimisation/alert-documentation/trunk/etc/alert-documentation.xml
-> Rpm create with this build http://dmarsvc02.spinvox.lan:8085/browse/MISC-ALERTDOCUMENTATION/
2) Wiki complementary documentation at this location: https://svwiki.nuance.com/wiki/pmwiki.php/Alerts/Ejector

Gotcha: make sure that a healthy system that is not processing traffic for more the X seconds tries to execute all optional task.
item.summary: EJS workflow needs to be able to skip "optional" tasks if they consecutively fail beyond an acceptable limit

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Has to be mainly evaluated in the load test.

Added OptionalTask to workflow for submitForScoring and deleteFromStorageManager tasks.

Code has been added in following svn repos:

  • https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/ejectorService/branches/EJS-108
  • http://mtl-mobi-rcs/svn-repos/vm2t/dev/engineering-repository/vmcs/trunk/ejector-service/v2t-ejector
Added OptionalTask to workflow for submitForScoring and deleteFromStorageManager tasks.

There are 3 configuration values for both unified scoring and file deletion in ejector-service.xml:

<min-consecutive-fail-duration-seconds-for-degraded-mode>120</min-consecutive-fail-duration-seconds-for-degraded-mode>
<min-consecutive-fail-requests-for-degraded-mode>100</min-consecutive-fail-requests-for-degraded-mode>
<degraded-mode-duration-seconds>300</degraded-mode-duration-seconds>

min-consecutive-fail-duration-seconds-for-degraded-mode defines the duration in seconds for which an optional task must fail before it enters into degrade mode.
min-consecutive-fail-requests-for-degraded-mode defines the no of consecutive failure requests for an optional task to enter into degrade mode.

Both the conditions above must meet for an optional task to enter in degrade mode.

degraded-mode-duration-seconds defines the duration for which an optional task would stay in degrade mode. During this time, optional task would be skipped.
timeout values were discussed in meeting 3/12 and this issue can be signed-off.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
• submitForScoring and deleteFromStorageManager should use OptionalTask
  • OptionalTask will remember when failure of the task started
  • When OptionalTask fails to execute successfully for X seconds in a row, the effective task will be skipped for Y seconds.
  • During the period (Y), the real task will not be executed, but it will be transparent to the WorkflowManager because OptionalTask will return success.

item.title: [EJS-106] Generate an audit file at every hour
item.description:
When the hours changes, the audit file rollover. This story is to make sure an audit file is generated for every hour, even if there is not traffic during this hours.

After an full hours without traffic, not for 60 minutes, but for a period from 10h00 and 11h00, an audit files containing only the headers must be generated.

Hint to test: change the configuration to roll over every minutes.
item.summary: Generate an audit file at every hour

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
File rollover is working as expected. Tested successfully with rollover frequency of "every minute" (minutely) configured on ejs config file. The server was started, no traffic whatsoever and the audit files were written every minute with only the headers.

Configuring EJS to rollover audit file every minute:
1) Edit /etc/spinvox/ejector-service/ejector-service.xml
2) Replace

<audit>
...
<rollover-frequency>hourly</rollover-frequency>
</audit>

for

<audit>
...
<rollover-frequency>minutely</rollover-frequency>
</audit>

Performed 2 tests:
1- rollover-frequency set to hourly
2- rollover-frequency set to minutely

The period of creating audit files is based on rollover-frequency value.

item.title: [EJS-103] Move EJS to Java 7
item.description:
The EJS should run on Oracle JDK 7.

The JDK 7 is already re-bundle into A RPM AS 1.6: sv-jdk7.

JDK 7 fix long lasting bug that may have been worked around. Full regression is required.

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/compatibility-417013.html

Also, as the first VMCS component to move on Java 7, the command line for the garbage collector needs to be ajusted to the new G1 GC with a "generic configuration". The GC configuration chosen will be used with all VMCS component moved to Java 7 and adjusted if required.

The current sv-jdk7 is to be repackage with the current system to the latest version (u40).

A new rpm, nu-jdk7-secure is to be created. It need to depends on the sv-jdk7 one, but add the JCE at the appropriate location wrt sv-jdk7 installation directory.

The JCE can be found here: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html

The JCE files, a .sh that creates a RPM and the required .spec file is to be in SVN at the following location:
https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/Releasing/specs/nu-jdk7-secure (same name as the RPM). A readme.txt file shuld be created with all the required information to recreate this RPM. An example can be found here:
https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/VM2T/UnifiedScoringService/trunk/tools/nu-uss-mysql-configuration
item.summary: Move EJS to Java 7

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Results of performance tests on EJS jdk6 with CMS garbage collection, jdk 7 with CMS garbage collection (same parameters as with jdk6) and jdk 7 with G1, garbage first garbage collection with no extra parameters (the recommended).
Results compiled from the same 4 hour test with 15 injections per second (900 injections per minute) with the EJS performance test, which stubs all EJS interfaces.
Run on machine mtl-blade10-02-vm1.

Based on the results, recommendation is to maintain CMS garbage collection while moving to jdk 7 as G1 is still in its initial phase and does not provide a marked improvement for garbage collection for EJS for the metrics observed and parameters used.

The following are available in the dev repo
sv-jdk7-1.7.0_40-1.x86_64.rpm (sv-jdk7)
nu-jdk7-secure-1.7.0-1.x86_64.rpm (nu-jdk7-secure)

The spec file et al. for nu-dk7-secure are available in the following location
https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/Releasing/specs/nu-jdk7-secure
nu-jdk7-secure.sh
nu-jdk7-secure.spec
UnlimitedJCEPolicyJDK7.zip as downloaded from oracle.

The jdk7 rpm was created by loosely following this (although most steps were done manually rather than with mc tool, which was giving errors):
https://wiki.spinvox.lan/wiki/pmwiki.php/DevWiki/Dev-release-rpm-build

Important for release notes:
nu-jdk7-secure must be installed with the following command
rpm -iv --replacefiles nu-jdk-secure-1.7.0-1.x86_64.rpm
as the rpm replaces some files in the jdk 7. This is acceptable, altho it should be noted that uninstalling nu-jdk7-secure requires a re-install of jdk7, otherwise jdk7 will not work (will throw errors while launching).

EJS using jdk7 is available as of
sv-java-ejectorservice-201310071316-2.6.7.56.89.x86_64.rpm
sv-java-ejectorservice-etc-201310071316-2.6.7.56.89.x86_64.rpm

Note that this version of EJS does not yet depend on nu-jdk7-secure.

Change in the approach.
Instead of having sv-jdk7 rpm and adding nu-jdk7-secure package, optionally, there will be 2 separate packages
sv-jdk7
nu-jdk7-jce (for java cryptography extension)

such that nu-jdk7-jce does not depend on sv-jdk7 rpm, it contains the full jdk with the additional jce files.
In dev repo the following rpm is available:
nu-jdk7-jce-1.7.0_45-1.x86_64.rpm

EJS .56 as of build 98 depends on nu-jdk7-jce.

The spec file for nu-jdk7-jce is located:
https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/Releasing/specs/nu-jdk7-jce.spec
(with https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/Releasing/specs/nu-jd7-secure removed).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: jdk7 and nu-secure must be in repo.

item.title: [EJS-86] During load tests EJS takes 2 hours to eject message when USS is unresponsive
item.description:
During load tests, the USS was unresponsive.
Messages normally taking less than 1 second to eject started taking 18 seconds.

Within 20 minutes of the problem initially occurring, the lag for ejection completion grew to 8 minutes, then 8 hours later its at 2 hours.

Note: This behavior will be fixed by EJS-108 and EJS-82
item.summary: During load tests EJS takes 2 hours to eject message when USS is unresponsive

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: In particular ejector-audit.csv.2013-08-22-09 is where things start to go wrong and ejecting starts taking ~18 seconds to complete.
This is a symptom. The real fix will be tracked by EJS-108 and EJS-82.

item.title: [EJS-85] EJS timeout should be configured to support a 5 minutes audio
item.description:
Just a few numbers I got for the meeting related with maximum number of characters:

The average number of characters in a voicemail message is 144. The longest message you can see in a day is 2094 characters long.

I show here the average processing time per message and the memory used for those messages.

150 characters
60 msec
0.25 Mbytes

2130 characters
980 msec
24 Mbytes

I also got number for much longer messages, text_processor deals fine with them but of course is slower and uses more memory.

5000 characters
5700 msec
100 Mbytes

10000 characters
15400 msec
240 Mbytes

15000 characters
25400 msec
380 Mbytes

20000 characters
36800 msec
520 Mbytes

Note, I ran those in my computer, it might be faster in the the real machines.

Daniel
item.summary: EJS timeout should be configured to support a 5 minutes audio

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: QA will do some testing to get the number of characters for a a minutes audio...

Current default timeout is 1 sec.

the request timeout is in: /text-processor-service/src/main/java/com/nuance/textprocessor/service/default-service.properties
request-handler.request-timeout-msecs=1000

From wiki page on Words per minute (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Words_per_minute).

a word is standardized to five characters

Audiobooks are recommended to be 150-160 words per minute, which is the range that people comfortably hear and vocalize words.[20]
Slide presentations tend to be closer to 100 wpm,[citation needed] auctioneers can speak at about 250 wpm,[citation needed] and the fastest speaking policy debaters speak from 350[21] to over 500 words per minute.[22][23] Internet speech calculators show that various things influence words per minute including nervousness.

Therefore if we use 5 minutes of audio at 150 wpm, we have 3750 characters.

R&D made performance improvements to the Text Processor.
The default timeout of 1 sec is sufficient for 5 minutes audios and more.
Case closed.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: ITN must not timed out with a voicemail of 5 minutes.

item.title: [EJS-82] Improve the Infinite eject retry to MSF
item.description:
EJS retries "indefinitly" to eject to MSF when MSF is not available, same thing when ejecting to GRS.

Here "indefinitly" means up to hard-tat.

We want the option to limit the number of attempst.

So we need:
1) New optional configuration: ejector-config/rest/max-retries (when not specified, MAX_INTEGER is the default.
2) Use the maxRetries in EjectToEPSTask.execute, when handling a "ExecutionTemporaryFailureException" to return a RetryableResult.dontRetry when number of attempt is exceeded.
item.summary: Improve the Infinite eject retry to MSF

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Added configuration "max-retries" in ejector-config/rest.

Added code to use the maxRetries in EjectToEPSTask.execute, when handling ExecutionTemporaryFailureException to return a RetryableResult.dontRetry when number of attempt is exceeded.

This change is available in EJS-82 branch (https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/ejectorService/branches/EJS-82)
Keshav ported his changes in branch 2.6.7.56 before leaving for its vacations.

This test has been automated Covered cases of MSF and GRS.
Tested with following RPMs:
sv-java-ejectorservice-201311051912-2.6.7.56.110.x86_64
sv-java-ejectorservice-etc-201311051912-2.6.7.56.110.x86_64

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
AC1: New optional configuration "max-retries" in ejector-config/rest
AC2: Use the maxRetries in EjectToEPSTask.execute, when handling a "ExecutionTemporaryFailureException" to return a RetryableResult.dontRetry when number of attempt is exceeded.

item.title: [EJS-77] Ejector configuration file should contain appropriate timeout values and max retries values
item.description:
The unified-scoring config should contain:

<unified-scoring>
<timeout>30000</timeout>
<max-retries>0</max-retries>
</unified-scoring>

The storage-manager config should contain :
<storage-manager>
<audio-retrieval>
<timeout>30000</timeout>
<max-retries>4</max-retries>
</audio-retrieval>
</storage-manager>

The workflow config should contain :
<workflow>
<alternate-thread-pool-size>20</alternate-thread-pool-size>
<retry-delay-in-milliseconds>100</retry-delay-in-milliseconds>
<manager>
<thread-count>100</thread-count>
<retry-thread-count>20</retry-thread-count>
<thread-delay-in-milliseconds>5</thread-delay-in-milliseconds>
</manager>
</workflow>

item.title: [EJS-76] INVESTIGATION SPIKE: Confirm if there is Audit Log Attribute at risk of having a "comma" in its possible values
item.description:
This spike is about checking the EJS Audit Log and confirm if there is one or more attributes that could include a "comma" in its values.

If YES, then we will have to create another story to resolve it (à la USS Audit Log). The exact release to resolve it is TBD

These are the audit columns for EJS:
scrid, profile, originalLanguage, finalLanguage, conversionStatus, conversionReason, classOfService, audioLengthMilliseconds, trimmedAudioLengthMilliseconds, gridRequeueCount, latticeConfidencePercentage, lastAgent, msfEjectionStatus, ejectElapsedTime, ejectRetries, submitToDPMElapsedTime, submitToDPMRetries,

submitToDPM, submitForScoring, submitToRoxanne, submitToRas, audioRetrieval, ElapsedTime, Retries

An option would be to incorporate the fix used in US-339 for all columns (http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-3.1/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringEscapeUtils.html#escapeCsv%28java.lang.String%29

item.title: [EJS-56] [itn] Integrate with module that performs ITN
item.description:
As Nuance, I want ITN to be preformed on some of the ejected message with transcribed text.

  • EJS will need extra configuration for ITN. Details will be provided in GRD-605.
  • ITN need to be perform, when applicable, before the post-processing.

ITN module will load some language pack(s). RAM will not be used by the EJS directly (xms/xmx unaffected), but but external processe(s). We need to ensure there is enough memory available on the host (TM02) for these. The exact momory required is TBD at this point, but it will be a function of the ITN configuration (number of text-processor process/number of language per process)

Does the user guide needs to be updated?
item.summary: [itn] Integrate with module that performs ITN

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Configuration rpm: sv-java-ejectorservice-2.6.7.56-201308161737-2.6.7.56.32.x86_64.rpm

This is not yet the final rpm, as research was asked to make some changes regarding the language data path.

Starting on thi release, the Text Processor (ITN) configuration is embedded into EJS main configuration file. This is what it looks like:
<text-processor>
<enabled>true</enabled>
<base-port>7100</base-port>
<generated-config>
<location>/opt/nuance/generated-config</location>
<instance-name-prefix>tps-instance</instance-name-prefix>
</generated-config>
<config>
<processor>
<data-location>/opt/nuance/language-models/text-processor</data-location>
<logging-level>INFO</logging-level>
<initialization-timeout-msecs>31313</initialization-timeout-msecs>
<shutdown-timeout-msecs>31313</shutdown-timeout-msecs>
</processor>
<request>
<response-timeout-msecs>313323</response-timeout-msecs>
<message>
<encoding>UTF-8</encoding>
<maximum-number-of-characters>8313</maximum-number-of-characters>
</message>
</request>
</config>
<instances>
<instance-1>
<supported-languages>en-US</supported-languages>
</instance-1>
</instances>
<selection>
<profiles>spinvox,nuance</profiles>
</selection>
</text-processor>

In order to perform ITN, the text processor must:
1) Be enabled
2) Have at least one instance configured
3) Have a list of profiles on which the ITN will be available

If Text Processor is disabled, then EJS will be started without supporting ITN.

Initialization:
---------------

During startup, Text Processor Service (the hosting application) will determine how many instances are configured. After that, it will generate a config file for each instance, and will save them at the folder specified in the property: text-processor.generated-config.location. This config file will be passed as parameter to the text processor (executable provided by R&D).

The Text Processor Service will fail if all configured instances fail to initialize or if none was configured.

A text processor instance may fail under certain circumstances:

  • It is configured with a language which is not supported
  • It fails to connect to the designated tcp port
  • It detects an invalid configuration
  • It fails to initialize before the initialization timeout expires
  • Other reasons may also prevent a text processor instance to initialize.
    If this happens, an information will be logged with the causes of the failure.

The Text Processor Service will initialize if at least one configured instance is initialized.

Developer's Note: Regarding the initialization, another option is to fail the Text Processor Service if at least one instance of the text processor fails. I'd like to have this approved by a broader audience (Martin, Remi, Involved QA) before changing the initial implementation.

Performing ITN (Inverted Text Normalization)
-------------------------------------------
Two attributes are used to determine whether a message will be submitted to ITN:

  • The message's profile.
  • The message's language.

Message Profile: Only the Ditech profile ones will be selected. The exact profiles still to be determined.
Language: Currently supported languages are: en-US, es-US and fr-FR* To be confirmed as currently the text processor supports fr-CA instead.

ITN selection and processing Flow
---------------------------------
Before sending a message for post-processing, a message will be validated whether:

  • message is not null
  • message's conversion status is not Unconvertible
  • message's converted text is not blank (not empty or not null)

If the message passes these initial validation it's then submitted to a message selector that will determine based on the message's profile if the message should be submitted to ITN.

If the message has the correct profile, then the message is submitted to ITN.

Upon receiving the message, the Text Processor Service will validate whether the message's language is supported. If yes, the message is finally submitted.

When a message is in the Text Processor Service, it's possible that it fails if one of the following happens:

  • The message's language is not supported
  • There's no available text processor to handle the current request. Currently a message will wait for 1 second before being discarded.
  • An error happens when processing the message
  • Text process crashes. (The hosting application will try to re-initialize it)
    In any case, the following will happen:
  • An error message is logged.
  • A Warning alarm is sent.
  • The original message will be returned to EJS

Debugging
---------
Two new appenders have been added to the log4j config file to allow debugging information to be included in the logs. By default they will only log INFO messages but it can be changed to DEBUG so that more detailed information will be logged.

Change the following appenders to include DEBUG messages:

  • com.nuance.v2t.ejector.itn
  • com.nuance.textprocessor

Once DEBUG level is selected, it's possible to track the activity by analyzing the debug messages.

Here is the path to the automated test cases:

Suite:ProjectVmcs.ClusterComponents.EjectorService.SuiteInvertedTextNormalization Suite:EjectorService.SuiteRegressionTesting.SuiteInvertedTextNormalization.SuiteValidateItnTraffic.SuiteValidateItnSupportedLanguagesAndMappings

item.title: [EJS-51] [QoS] Send the QoS score in ConversionResponse
item.description:
As EPS, I want to receive the QoS flag in the ConversionResponse, when a value is present in the Message object.

The Message object will optionally contain a QoS flag (float value between 1.0 and 5.0), when present, this value is to be mapped in the corresponding optional element in the ConversionResponse (response/qosScore).

The dependency on common-eps-interface is to be updated to get the new version of ConversionResponse.
The dependency on common-entities is to be updated to be able to extract the qosScore wen present.

The XSD of the ConversionResponse can be found here:

https://svn.spinvox.lan/svn/spinvox.architecture/design.documents/working/Flexible_Codec/PROP-ConversionResponse_fix2%20with%20qosScore.xsd
item.summary: [QoS] Send the QoS score in ConversionResponse

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
A1:
For each message M sent to EJS with a qos score, a corresponding ConversionResponse CR will be sent to EPS or GRS. CR will contain the qos score.

A2:
For each message M sent to EJS with a qos score, a corresponding ConversionResponse CR will be sent to EPS or GRS. CR will not contain a qos score.

1) The common-eps-interface has a version when the qosScore is part of the schema.
2) the common-entities has a version that can expose the qos score,

item.title: [EJS-48] Eject messages via GRS
item.description: As a GRS I want messages to be ejected via me so I can know when messages have completed processing
item.summary: Eject messages via GRS

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Added test procedure and message template used for testing as attached documents.
GRS was tested in Slough Stage and the Montreal integration environments.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Healthcheck (pass)
    Given an offline Ejector Instance X
    and a running GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    When X is started
    Then the connection to Y will be tested
    and an [INFO] log will report that the GRS Healthcheck [passed]
  1. 2 - Healthcheck (fail)
    Given an offline Ejector Instance X
    and an offline GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    When X is started
    Then the connection to Y will be tested
    and an [ERROR] log will report that the GRS Healthcheck [failed]
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be sent
    and X will be shutdown
  1. 3 - Healthcheck (GRS not enabled)
    Given an offline Ejector Instance X
    and an offline GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [disabled] GRS
    When X is started
    Then the connection to Y will not be tested
    and a log will report that the GRS Healthcheck [IGNORED]
  1. 4 - Send messages via GRS
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a running GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
     and a message Z which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and message Z identifies its return address as W in the message object
    When the message has completed DPM procedures
    Then message Z will be ejected to Y
    and X will not send the message to W

NOTE : All AC's below this point change the AC's of EJS-24 replacing GRS

  1. 5 - Failure first back off
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a unresponsive GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    and the GRS interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 6 - Failure second back off
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a unresponsive GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has been tried [1] time
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    and the GRS interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [1000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 7 - Failure third back off
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a unresponsive GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has been tried [2] times
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    and the GRS interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 8 - Failure forth back off
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a unresponsive GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has been tried [3] times
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    and the GRS interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 9 - HardTAT
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a unresponsive GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the message Y Hard TAT time has already passed
    When the message is due to be sent for Ejection
    Then the message Y will be marked as [Unconvertible]
    and the converted text will be removed
     and message Y will be sent for DPM procedures
    and no attempts to send the message Y to the GRS will be attempted
    and the audit line will note that the message was changed to unconvertible and not ejected via the restful interface
    and a [ERROR] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
  1. 10 - 4xx errors
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a running GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    and the restful interface returns a response code in the [4**] range
    Then the message Y will be marked as [Unconvertible]
    and the converted text will be removed
     and message Y will be sent for DPM procedures
    and no more attempts to send the message Y to the GRS will be attempted
    and the audit line will note that the message was changed to unconvertible and not ejected via the restful interface
    and a [ERROR] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
  1. 11 - 5xx errors
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    and the restful interface returns a response code in the [5**] range
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 12 - Converted
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [converted]
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Converted]
  1. 13 - Language changed and converted
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [converted]
    and the converted language of Y is different language then the injection language
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Converted and Changed Language]
  1. 14 - Hangup
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [hangup]
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Hangup]
  1. 15 - Unconvertible
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [Unconvertible]
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Unconvertible]
  1. 16 - Unconvertible (bad audio)
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [Unconvertible]
    and the conversion reason of Y is [bad audio]
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [BadAudio]
  1. 17 - Unconvertible (No resources available)
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [Unconvertible]
    and the conversion reason of Y is [No resources available]
    When the message Y is sent for Ejection to GRS instance Y
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [No resources available]
  1. 18 - GRS returns a 208 response
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and a GRS instance Y
    and X is configured to use Y
    and X is configured to [enable] GRS
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message is sent to Y
    and a [208] response is returned
    Then the audit line will note that a [208] response was returned
     and message Y will be sent for DPM procedures

item.title: [EJS-33] Change Unified and Roxanne queuing strategy
item.description: As an Operations Team I want the queueing strategy changed for Unified and Roxanne so that scoring and retention problems do not affect normal ejection
item.summary: Change Unified and Roxanne queuing strategy

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
In order to test this story, a Unified Scoring Service which responds with a specified delay is needed.

1) Set Unified Scoring Service delay to 10 seconds.
2) Change timeout value for Unified Scoring ejection in ejector-service.xml to 11 seconds.
3) Change workflow thread count and retry thread count to 1.
4) Make 10 requests to ejector service quickly.
5) After 10 seconds, 10 messages should be ejected to MSF and 1 message should be ejected to Unified Scoring. Stats page for work queue should state that there are 9 messages in the work queue.
6) After 100 seconds, all messages should be ejected to Unified Scoring and audit file for ejector service should contain 10 messages with correct data.
The statement "and send to Unified Scoring is set for [0] retires " in AC2 is misleading as the number of retries cannot be configured and is always 0.
Not possible to fully test in the Stage environment as we can't use stubs.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Unified Queue does not affect message arrival
    Given a running Ejector instance X
    and X is in a valid environment
    and X is configured to use MSF Y
    and X is connected to Unified Scoring stub that is configured to not respond in [1000] seconds
    and X has [10] workflow threads
    and X has a Unified Scoring timeout of [1000] seconds
    and [10] messages have been injected into X
    When a message Z is injected into X
    Then Z will be sent to Y without delay
    and the post ejection queue statistic will have a size of [1]
  1. 2 - Only one attempt to send to Unified Scoring
    Given a running Ejector instance X
    and X is in a valid environment
    and send to Unified Scoring is set for [0] retires
    and X is configured to use Unified Scoring Y
    and Y is not responding
    When message Z is sent to X
    and sending to Unified Scoring has timed out
    Then Z will only try to send Y once
    and will then be sent to Roxanne

• Separate threads from main thread pool.
  • How many threads do we need?
  • Make 0 retries an option.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Failure first back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
     and the configuration for X contains :
      - Scoring submission back off time [500,1000,2000]
      - Scoring submission timeout [2000] milliseconds
    When the message Y is sent for scoring submission
     and Unified Scoring does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
     and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
     and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 2 - Failure second back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
     and the configuration for X contains :
      - Scoring submission back off time [500,1000,2000]
      - Scoring submission timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Scoring submission max retries [5]
     and a message Y tried to submit to Unified Scoring [1] time
    When the message Y is sent for scoring submission
     and Unified Scoring does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [1000] milliseconds and then retried
     and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
     and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 3 - Failure third back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
     and the configuration for X contains :
      - Scoring submission back off time [500,1000,2000]
      - Scoring submission timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Scoring submission max retries [5]
     and a message Y tried to submit to Unified Scoring [2] times
    When the message Y is sent for scoring submission
     and Unified Scoring does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
     and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
     and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 4 - Failure forth back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
     and the configuration for X contains :
      - Scoring submission back off time [500,1000,2000]
      - Scoring submission timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Scoring submission max retries [5]
     and a message Y tried to submit to Unified Scoring [3] times
    When the message Y is sent for scoring submission
     and Unified Scoring does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
     and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
     and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 5 - Giveup
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
     and the configuration for X contains :
      - Scoring submission back off time [500,1000,2000]
      - Scoring submission timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Scoring submission max retries [5]
     and a message Y tried to submit to Unified Scoring [4] times
    When the message Y is sent for scoring submission
     and Unified Scoring does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will continue Ejection
     and there will be no more attempts to send the message Y to Unified Scoring
     and the audit line will note that the message was not sent to Unified Scoring
     and a [ERROR] log will be written to the EJS log
     and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised

• Backoff configuration
  • Max retries
  • Will block EJS-26
  • The config in these AC's are only for example

item.title: [EJS-29] Update and run Ejector Performance Tests
item.description: As an Operations Team I want the performance tests updated and run for the Ejector Service so I can be confident that the changes made have not had a detrimental effect
item.summary: Update and run Ejector Performance Tests

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Realistic workload mixed ejection
    Given a valid test environment
    and a Ejector Service instance is up and running
    When the 4 hour test is started:
    Then [100] random requests per second should be injected including:
  • lite [80%]
  • assured [20%]
  • converted [90%]
  • unconvertible [5%]
  • hangup [5%]
  • restful ejection [50%]
  • soap ejection [50%]
  • messages requiring audio return [2%]
    and the following graphs will be available:
  • injection frequency
  • times taken to inject
  • ejection frequency
  • times taken to eject
  • number of injection errors
  • number of ejection errors
  • memory usage
  • disk usage
  1. 2 - Realistic workload all restful ejections
    Given a valid test environment
    and a Ejector Service instance is up and running
    When the 4 hour test is started:
    Then [100] random requests per second should be injected including:
  • lite [80%]
  • assured [20%]
  • converted [90%]
  • unconvertible [5%]
  • hangup [5%]
  • restful ejection [100%]
  • messages requiring audio return [2%]
    and the following graphs will be available:
  • injection frequency
  • times taken to inject
  • ejection frequency
  • times taken to eject
  • number of injection errors
  • number of ejection errors
  • memory usage
  • disk usage
  1. 3 - Failure scenarios and effects
    Given a valid test environment
    and a Ejector Service instance is up and running
    and the MSF/EPS stub is not accepting messages
    When the 4 hour test is started:
    Then [100] random requests per second should be injected including:
  • lite [80%]
  • assured [20%]
  • converted [90%]
  • unconvertible [5%]
  • hangup [5%]
  • restful ejection [50%]
  • soap ejection [50%]
  • messages requiring audio return [2%]
    and the following graphs will be available:
  • injection frequency
  • times taken to inject
  • ejection frequency
  • times taken to eject
  • number of injection errors
  • number of ejection errors
  • memory usage
  • disk usage

• Add restful interface
  • Add a percentage of audio return messages

item.title: [EJS-28] Retrieve audio from Storage Manager on flagged messages
item.description: As a EPS I want the audio data returned for messages that were injected with audio pass through data so I can be sure the correct data is returned after VMCS processing
item.summary: Retrieve audio from Storage Manager on flagged messages

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Ilan will start on this while I finish the AC's

Found a bug –
EJS-41. This impacts signing off this story.

QA Testing —

AC#1 –

Send a Submit request for EJS with the entry in the XML –

a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface

NOTE: XML Request contains –

<respondWithAudio>true</respondWithAudio>
<receivedOnLegacySoapInterface>false</receivedOnLegacySoapInterface>

and ensure that
and Storage Manager Z contains the audio file for Y ( Send Request to SM )
