customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Happy Path
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and Storage Manager Z contains the audio file for Y
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    Then the audio for message Y will be retrieved from Storage Manager Z
    and the message sent out via the restful interface will contain the audio data
    and the audit file will contain:
  • audioRetrievalElapsedTime [~ time taken]
  • audioRetrievalRetries []
  1. 2 - Audio not found
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and Storage Manager Z does not contain the audio file for Y
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    Then the message sent out via the restful interface without the audio data
    and an {ERROR] log will be created
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
  1. 3 - Error returned by Storage Manager
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Storage Manager Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Storage Manager timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Storage Manager max reties [4]
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    and Storage Manager Z responds with a [5**] error
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 4 - Failure first back off
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Storage Manager Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Storage Manager timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Storage Manager max reties [4]
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    and Storage Manager Z does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 5 - Failure second back off
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Storage Manager Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Storage Manager timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Storage Manager max reties [4]
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has tried to retrieve audio [1] time
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    and Storage Manager Z does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [1000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 6 - Failure third back off
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Storage Manager Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Storage Manager timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Storage Manager max reties [4]
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has tried to retrieve audio [2] times
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    and Storage Manager Z does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 7 - Failure forth back off
    Given a running Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Storage Manager Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Storage Manager timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Storage Manager max reties [4]
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has tried to retrieve audio [3] times
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    and Storage Manager Z does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 8 - Storage Manager Give Up
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Storage Manager Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Storage Manager timeout [2000] milliseconds
  • Storage Manager max reties [4]
    and a message Y is flagged as needing audio ejection
    and message Y is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has tried to retrieve audio [4] times
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    Then the message sent out via the restful interface without the audio data
    and an [ERROR] log will be created
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
    and the audit file will contain:
  • audioRetrievalElapsedTime [~ time taken to fail separated by ":"]
  • audioRetrievalRetries [4]

• Get storage manager uri from message
  • No need for health check
  • Retry strategy?
  • SM errors?

item.title: [EJS-27] Update MSF Timings used to fix backlog issue with MSF
item.description:
In Logicalis when one MSF in the pool takes too long to respond, the timings used by the Ejector service causes the problem to get worse by bombarding MSF.

Current timing used are

<timeout>2000</timeout>
<backofftimes>500,1000,2000</backofftimes>

We want to try longer initial timeout, then quick backoff (hoping to get another MSF) followed by progressively longer timeouts e.g.

<timeout>5000</timeout>
<backofftimes>1000,5000,10000,20000</backofftimes>
item.summary: Update MSF Timings used to fix backlog issue with MSF

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
dev and live msf settings in ejector-service.xml files updated as follows

<timeout>5000</timeout>
<backofftimes>1000,5000,10000,20000</backofftimes>

24 hours - 400 vm/min load test was successfully run and visual verification of the configuration was made. QA cannot verify that this update reduces MSF crashes, but we are confident that these changes will not adversely affect the release.

item.title: [EJS-26] Update Ejector Audit to contain new data
item.description: As a BID Team I want more values added to the Ejector Service audit so I can get more details from the audit file
item.summary: Update Ejector Audit to contain new data

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Vijay has begun work on this story

blocked due to EJS-30 needs unified scoring retry
audit retry development completed for all service, except MSF and DPM as agreed.
Attached Ejector Audit Lines from QA testing
Bug EJS-42- affects AC#11 and 12.

Retest of this bug.
Retesting AC#11 and 12 using the STUB -eps_retry_run.sh

Note:

ejectElapsedTime ejectRetries
1151:1046:128 2

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Creation of header
    Given an offline Ejector Service X
    and no audit files have been created
    When X is started
    Then a new audit file will be created with a header containing column headers :
  • scrid
  • profile
  • originalLanguage
  • finalLanguage
  • conversionStatus
  • conversionReason
  • classOfService
  • audioLengthMilliseconds
  • trimmedAudioLengthMilliseconds
  • gridRequeueCount
  • latticeConfidencePercentage
  • lastAgent
  • msfEjectionStatus
  • ejectElapsedTime
  • ejectRetries
  • submitToDPMElapsedTime
  • submitForScoringElapsedTime
  • submitForScoringRetries
  • submitToRoxanneElapsedTime
  • submitToRoxanneRetries
  • submitToRasElapsedTime
  • submitToRasRetries
  • startWork
  • endWork
  • notes
  1. 2 - Do not add multiple headers to audit file on restart
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a audit files Y have been created
    When X is restarted
    Then no new lines will be added to the audit file
  1. 3 - Task failure reporting DPM (one failure)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for DPM tasks
    and the submit to DPM task fails once taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and then the DPM task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete
    When message Y completes all tasks in X
    Then the audit line for X will contain :
  • submitToDPMElapsedTime = ~[2000:100]
  1. 4 - Task failure reporting DPM (two failures)
    NOT POSSIBLE
  1. 5 - Task failure reporting Roxanne (one failure)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for the Roxanne task
    and the submit to Roxanne task fails once taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and then the Roxanne task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete
    When message Y completes all tasks in X
    Then the audit line for X will contain :
  • submitToRoxanneElapsedTime = ~[2000:100]
  • submitToRoxanneRetries = 1
  1. 6 - Task failure reporting Roxanne (two failures)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for the Roxanne task
    and the submit to Roxanne task fails taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and the second attempt to submit to Roxanne task fails taking [2100] milliseconds to fail
    and then the Roxanne task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete
    When message Y completes all tasks in X
    Then the audit line for X will contain :
  • submitToRoxanneElapsedTime = ~[2000:2100:100]
  • submitToRoxanneRetries = 2
  1. 7 - Task failure reporting Unified Scoring (one failure)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for the Unified Scoring task
    and the submit to Scoring task fails once taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and then the Scoring task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete
    When message Y completes all tasks in X
    Then the audit line for X will contain :
  • submitToScoringElapsedTime = ~[2000:100]
  • submitToScoringRetries = 1
  1. 8 - Task failure reporting Unified Scoring (two failures)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for the Unified Scoring task
    and the submit to Scoring task fails taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and the second attempt to submit to Scoring task fails taking [2100] milliseconds to fail
    and then the Scoring task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete
    When message Y completes all tasks in X
    Then the audit line for X will contain :
  • submitToRoxanneElapsedTime = ~[2000:2100:100]
  • submitToRoxanneRetries = 2
  1. 9 - Task failure reporting MSF (one failure)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for the MSF task
    and the submit to MSF task fails once taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and then the MSF task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete

    Then the audit line for X will contain :

  1. 10 - Task failure reporting MSF (two failures)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y
    and Y has been injected into X
    and X has a timeout configuration of [2000] milliseconds for the MSF task
    and the submit to MSF task fails taking [2000] milliseconds to fail
    and the second attempt to submit to MSF task fails taking [2100] milliseconds to fail
    and then the MSF task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete
    When message Y completes all tasks in X
    Then the audit line for X will contain :

  1. 11 - Task failure reporting Restful Ejection (one failure)
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message Y

    and then the restful ejection task is successful and takes [100] milliseconds to complete

item.title: [EJS-25] Provide audio information
item.description: As a Unified Scoring I want to be informed of the audio information gathered so I can make use of the information
item.summary: Provide audio information

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Completed.

Most significant change of code is in unified-scoring-service-client, converting a common-entity.Message to ScoringRequest.

BUG:
When messages are sent to Unified Scoring from EJS(lite messages), there is a timeout error in EJS submitting the messages to US.

Also the retry of ejector services is supposed to be 1. 2. 3
Based on the config

500] milliseconds and then retried, 1000 ms, 2000 ms

Actual:
DEBUG com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.SubmitForScoringTask - Unified Scoring submission retry [0] for [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] using delay of [500] ms

2013-03-07 14:54:59,637 [Workflow-pool-1-Thread-26] [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] DEBUG com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.SubmitToDPMTask - Finished sending [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] to dpm
2013-03-07 14:55:01,704 [pool-1-thread-1] [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] DEBUG com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.SubmitForScoringTask - Unified Scoring submission retry [0] for [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] using delay of [500] ms
2013-03-07 14:55:01,706 [pool-1-thread-1] [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] WARN com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.SubmitForScoringTask - Failed to submit [20130307145216-dlogvm81-32294-55] to Unified Scoring http://unified-scoring-vhost:8509/scoring/request reason [java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out]

Fixed the retry-count problem. It will now start counting from 1 (example in the last line bellow):

2013-03-08 09:24:36,384 [pool-1-thread-1] [] DEBUG com.nuance.workflow.WorkflowManager - [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] Executing task [submitForScoring]
2013-03-08 09:24:36,431 [959580737@qtp-1472770637-0] [] DEBUG com.nuance.common.stub.unifiedscoringservice.resources.ScoringRequestResource - Received incoming scoring request
2013-03-08 09:24:36,431 [pool-1-thread-1] [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] WARN com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.SubmitForScoringTask - Failed to submit [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] to Unified Scoring http://localhost:8509/scoring/request status [500] reason [It didn't work!]
2013-03-08 09:24:36,431 [pool-1-thread-1] [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] DEBUG com.spinvox.common.alerting.nagios.NagiosAlertable - Sent passive alert: [localhost:6667] [WARNING] [Ejector - Unified Scoring Ejection] [Failed to submit [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] to Unified Scoring http://localhost:8509/scoring/request status [500] reason [It didn't work!]]
2013-03-08 09:24:36,431 [pool-1-thread-1] [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] DEBUG com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.SubmitForScoringTask - Unified Scoring submission retry [1] for [20130308092436-UMLAPIKALATI-9716-1] will use delay of [500] ms

EJS-25 —
Hi Jarrad,
Based on EJS-25 story message object should contain a field - Audio Type.
During testing I find that when I add the element - (<audioContentType>g711</audioContentType>) to the EJS xml request the output in the log in Unified Scoring is displayed as Audio encoding: g711.
If field names keep changing this will be a problem for testers.
There should be consistency in translating this fields from one component to another.

Note: the Storage manager now is the Normal Storage Manager with the URI slightly different from the uri for SM for Unified Scoring

<ClusterMetadata>
<storage-manager-uri>http://10.20.50.83:8080/storagemanager</storage-manager-uri>
<msf-uri>http://msf-vhost:8086/msf</msf-uri>
</ClusterMetadata>

/ejector/ejectMessage POST Submit a message for ejection-----

URL IN POSTER --http://10.20.50.98:8513/ejector/ejectMessage

Content Type must be application/xml---- To be able to inject

XML TO INJECT TO THE EJECTOR SERVICES--

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<message>
<Metadata>
<scrid>20130325171836-dlogvm81-32294-76</scrid>
<profile>spinvox-test</profile>
<language>en-US</language>
<class-of-service>lite</class-of-service>
<uniq-id>1339</uniq-id>

<AnotherMetadata><anItem>aValue</anItem>
</AnotherMetadata>
</message>

-------

Checking the Unfied Scoring Logs —

2013-03-25 11:03:02,248 [qtp1650319731-239 - /scoring/request] [20130325141614-dlogvm81-32294-10] DEBUG ScoringRequestResource - Scoring request validated OK [20130325141614-dlogvm81-32294-10]

2013-03-25 11:03:02,249 [qtp1650319731-239 - /scoring/request] [20130325141614-dlogvm81-32294-10] DEBUG StorageProcessor - Retention allowed for Scrid 20130325141614-dlogvm81-32294-10

Log 2 ---- g711

2013-03-25 11:19:14,002 [qtp1650319731-237 - /scoring/request] [20130307171836-dlogvm81-32294-57] DEBUG ScoringRequestResource - Scoring request validated OK [20130307171836-dlogvm81-32294-57]
2013-03-25 11:19:14,002 [qtp1650319731-237 - /scoring/request] [20130307171836-dlogvm81-32294-57] DEBUG StorageProcessor - Processing scrid: 20130307171836-dlogvm81-32294-57
2013-03-25 11:19:14,002 [qtp1650319731-237 - /scoring/request] [20130307171836-dlogvm81-32294-57] DEBUG StorageProcessor - Audio encoding: g711 ****************

---------

For AC# 2 and AC#3 to see the Request that EJS sends to Unified Scoring,
we need to set up Fiddler as the UNified Scoring and capture the request sent to Unfied scoring in Fiddler –

This is done by changing the ejector-service.xml, to use ejector-service.xml.fiddler=US
which contains –

<base-uri>http://unified-scoring-vhost:8509/scoring</base-uri> = <base-uri>http://10.134.0.111:8888/scoring</base-uri>

Thats means that the local machine is acting as Unified scoring – with Fiddler

Check the requet link in Ejector request in Fiddler –

http://10.20.50.98:8513/ejector/ejectMessage/

an dcheck the XML

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Message contains audio type
    Given a running Ejector instance X
    and X is configured to submit scoring requests to Z
    and an incoming message object Y that contains audio type field : [G711]
    and Y contains trimmed audio length [5000]
    When the scoring request is sent to Z
    Then the request will contain:
  • audio type [G711]
  • trimmed audio length [5000]
  1. 2 - Message does not contain audio type
    Given a running Ejector instance X
    and X is configured to submit scoring requests to Z
    and an incoming message object Y does not contain the audio type field
    and Y contains trimmed audio length [5000]
    When the scoring request is sent to Z
    Then the request will contain:
  • trimmed audio length [5000]
  1. 3 - Message does not contain trimmed audio length
    Given a running Ejector instance X
    and X is configured to submit scoring requests to Z
    and an incoming message object Y does not contain the audio type field
    and Y does not contain the trimmed audio length field
    When the scoring request is sent to Z
    Then the request will not contain the trimmed audio length field

• Some optional?
  • Trimmed audio length
  • Played with US-273

item.title: [EJS-24] Allow use of restful ejection interface
item.description: As a MSF I want messages received trough restful injection to be returned through restful ejection so I can handle the messages correctly
item.summary: Allow use of restful ejection interface

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Add <serviceType>GOLD</serviceType> to the conversion response.
See attached email

This issue is affected by GA-14 AC#10.

See comment from BA.
Jarrad "Awesome" Clark added a comment - 17/Apr/13 11:20:42
Changed AC #10 reason text. This needs to be fixed and re-tested.

attachment.name: Re Initial document for changes required to support Flexible codecs.msg
attachment.author: Diven_Topiwala

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Success and then send for DPM work
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface returns a valid response
    Then the message Y will be sent for DPM procedures
  1. 2 - Failure first back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 3 - Failure second back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has been tried [1] time
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [1000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 4 - Failure third back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has been tried [2] times
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 5 - Failure forth back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and a message Y has been tried [3] times
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 6 - HardTAT
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the message Y Hard TAT time has already passed
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection
    Then the message Y will be marked as [Unconvertible]
    and the converted text will be removed
     and message Y will be sent for DPM procedures
    and no more attempts to send the message Y to the restful ejection interface will be attempted
    and the audit line will note that the message was changed to unconvertible and not ejected via the restful interface
    and a [ERROR] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
  1. 7 - 4xx errors
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface returns a response code in the [4**] range
    Then the message Y will be marked as [Unconvertible]
    and the converted text will be removed
     and message Y will be sent for DPM procedures
    and no more attempts to send the message Y to the restful ejection interface will be attempted
    and the audit line will note that the message was changed to unconvertible and not ejected via the restful interface
    and a [ERROR] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
  1. 8 - 5xx errors
    Given a Ejector Service instance X
    and the configuration for X contains :
  • Restful Ejection Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Restful Ejection timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    and the restful interface returns a response code in the [5**] range
    Then the message Y will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 9 - Converted
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [converted]
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Converted]
  1. 10 - Language changed and converted
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [converted]
    and the converted language of Y is different language then the injection language
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Converted and Changed Language]
  1. 11 - Hangup
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [hangup]
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Hangup]
  1. 12 - Unconvertible
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [Unconvertible]
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [Unconvertible]
  1. 13 - Unconvertible (bad audio)
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [Unconvertible]
    and the conversion reason of Y is [bad audio]
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [BadAudio]
  1. 14 - Unconvertible (No resources available)
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a message Y which is flagged as using the restful ejection interface
    and the conversion status of Y is [Unconvertible]
    and the conversion reason of Y is [No resources available]
    When the message Y is sent for restful Ejection to the return address contained in the message object
    Then the message Y will contain :
  • Conversion Status [NOT_TRANSCRIBED]
  • Reason Status [No resources available]

• Kristijan's team will provide xsd
  • Can handle new response codes and reasons
  • MSF / EPS stub
  • Return URI given by message

item.title: [EJS-23] Update Ejector Service to use new message object
item.description: As a Development Team I want the Ejector Service updated to use the new message object so I can make future changes to the message object easier to deploy.
item.summary: Update Ejector Service to use new message object

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
QA Started testing this issue

NOTE : To test this issue as you are injecting directly to EJS –
Ensure you use SCRID that MSF already knows about

TO USE THE NEW COMPONENT ------

TWO WAYS OF SETTING THIS IS

1) Below is example of message with NEW Metadata section e.g. AnotherMetadata - at the end....

EXAMPLE – <AnotherMetadata><anItem>aValue</anItem></AnotherMetadata>

2) Below is example of message with NEW item within an existing Metadata section e.g. aMetadataItem in ScoringMetadata

EXAMPLE — <aMetadataItem>aValue</aMetadataItem></

#1 —

XML TO INJECT TO THE EJECTOR SERVICES--

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<message>
<Metadata>
<scrid>20111019141509-tester-26159-2</scrid>
<profile>spinvox</profile>
<language>en-US</language>
<class-of-service>assured</class-of-service>
<uniq-id>1234</uniq-id>
<is-full-automated>false</is-full-automated>
<called-number>07777777</called-number>
<calling-number>078888888</calling-number>
<max-conversion-length>500</max-conversion-length>
<priority>100</priority>
<audio-length-milliseconds>10000</audio-length-milliseconds>
<trimmed-audio-length-milliseconds>8000</trimmed-audio-length-milliseconds>
<dpm-mode>online</dpm-mode>
<conversion-status>Converted</conversion-status>
<retention-policy>standard</retention-policy>
<detected-language>en-US</detected-language>
<supported-languages>en-GB:lite</supported-languages>
<message-id>message id</message-id>
<message-received>2011-10-19 14:15:09.494</message-received>
<converted-text>test-pass-through-value</converted-text>
<hard-tat>2012-10-19 14:15:09.494</hard-tat>
</Metadata>
<GridMetadata>
<lattice-confidence-percentage>90</lattice-confidence-percentage>
</GridMetadata>
<ScoringMetadata>
<transcriber-name>Grid</transcriber-name>
<transcriber-qc-house>QCHouse</transcriber-qc-house>
</ScoringMetadata>
<ClusterMetadata>
<storage-manager-uri>http://storage-manager-host:8080/storagemanager</storage-manager-uri>
<msf-uri>http://msf-vhost:8086/msf</msf-uri>
</ClusterMetadata>
<AnotherMetadata><anItem>aValue</anItem>
</AnotherMetadata>
</message>

#2
XML TO INJECT

Below is example of message <aMetadataItem>aValue</aMetadataItem> Within the scoring Metadata.

So to the XML value above will add the new line of XML –

XML TO INJECT TO THE EJECTOR SERVICES--

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<message>
<Metadata>
<scrid>20111019141509-tester-26159-1</scrid>
<profile>spinvox</profile>
<language>en-US</language>
<class-of-service>assured</class-of-service>
<uniq-id>1234</uniq-id>
<is-full-automated>false</is-full-automated>
<called-number>07777777</called-number>
<calling-number>078888888</calling-number>
<max-conversion-length>500</max-conversion-length>
<priority>100</priority>
<audio-length-milliseconds>10000</audio-length-milliseconds>
<trimmed-audio-length-milliseconds>8000</trimmed-audio-length-milliseconds>
<dpm-mode>online</dpm-mode>
<conversion-status>Converted</conversion-status>
<retention-policy>standard</retention-policy>
<detected-language>en-US</detected-language>
<supported-languages>en-GB:lite</supported-languages>
<message-id>message id</message-id>
<message-received>2011-10-19 14:15:09.494</message-received>
<converted-text>test-pass-through-value</converted-text>
<hard-tat>2012-10-19 14:15:09.494</hard-tat>
<aMetadataItem>aValue</aMetadataItem>
</Metadata>
<GridMetadata>
<lattice-confidence-percentage>90</lattice-confidence-percentage>
</GridMetadata>
<ScoringMetadata>
<transcriber-name>Grid</transcriber-name>
<transcriber-qc-house>QCHouse</transcriber-qc-house>
</ScoringMetadata>
<ClusterMetadata>
<storage-manager-uri>http://storage-manager-host:8080/storagemanager</storage-manager-uri>
<msf-uri>http://msf-vhost:8086/msf</msf-uri>
</ClusterMetadata>
</message>

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Accepts and send to MSF and Roxanne
    Given a running Ejector Service X upgraded to the new message object version
    and X is configured to eject messages via MSF Y
    and X is configured to send messages to Roxanne Z
    and a message W containing a custom value [test-pass-through-value] = [This is a test value]
    When message W is enqueued into X
    The the details of W will be sent to Y
    and message W will be sent to Z
    and the message W will contain : [test-pass-through-value] = [This is a test value]

item.title: [EJS-19] Inconstent Ejector message finalisation
item.description: Both TEP and AA still set their own final conversion status in DPM and consequently call the messageconverted procedure there not within EJS which does the send to MSF. All the ejection logic was intended to be in Ejector Service.
item.summary: Inconstent Ejector message finalisation

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [EJS-16] cluster monitor should not disable a cluster where retention manager is not running
item.description:
as noc dude I don't want failing retention managers to disable a cluster

We had NRG failures cause all the retention managers to seize up and fail at the same time. All clusters were marked as down at the same time. We overrode the default behaviour in live using RFC 7570.
item.summary: cluster monitor should not disable a cluster where retention manager is not running

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This issue will be verified by the Montreal QA team
I will let you know when Marlow deliverables are ready of 2.6.5.71 are ready for stage
Hi Ali can you please provide status

This is the test that was done

  • All components up and running - checked http://mtl-qabladee-02:9999/clusterMonitor/clusterstatus - all components setup to true
  • Stop Retention manager - http://mtl-qabladee-02:9999/clusterMonitor/clusterstatus- shows RetentionManager
    false false
  • Verify http://10.3.40.113:9999/clusterMonitor/lbinterface

mtl-qabladee-02:/etc/snmp # curl -vN -X GET http://10.3.40.113:9999/clusterMonitor/lbinterface

  • About to connect() to 10.3.40.113 port 9999
  • Trying 10.3.40.113... connected
  • Connected to 10.3.40.113 (10.3.40.113) port 9999
    > GET /clusterMonitor/lbinterface HTTP/1.1
    > User-Agent: curl/7.15.1 (x86_64-suse-linux) libcurl/7.15.1 OpenSSL/0.9.8a zlib/1.2.3 libidn/0.6.0
    > Host: 10.3.40.113:9999
    > Accept: /
    >
    < HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    < Content-Type: text/html;charset=utf-8
    < Content-Length: 0
  • Connection #0 to host 10.3.40.113 left intact
  • Closing connection #0

No traffic was injected during this test.

Hope what we did was correct. Please let us know if is enough.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: given retention manager is not running on a cluster's tm02 but all mandatory components that cluster monitor monitors are running and functional cluster monitor's status page (http://localhost:9999/clusterMonitor/clusterstatus) should indicate Retention Manager is not running, but the load balancer interface of cluster monitor (http://localhost:9999/clusterMonitor/lbinterface) should still return a success code (200 OK)

item.title: [EJS-15] Update ops guides for Ejector
item.description: As a NOC Engineer I want the Operations guide updated to reflect the changes made for Ejector
item.summary: Update ops guides for Ejector

status.description: Agile Story ready for QA

comments.comment: Original version already contains latest additions to EJS (disabling RAS in config, and new stats around conversion-status break down of messages ejected by language and by profile).

item.title: [EJS-14] Enable / Disabled RAS in Ejector
item.description: As a Product Manager I want the ability to enable and disabled RAS in the the Ejector via configuration so I can disable RAS in the Ejector
item.summary: Enable / Disabled RAS in Ejector

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
EJS-14 QA:

Set ras to Disabled in EJS
<ras>
<enabled>false</enabled>
<base-uri>http://ras-vhost:8512/ras</base-uri>
<uri>
<is-alive>/isAlive</is-alive>
</uri>
<timeout>1000</timeout>
</ras>

ras has to be disabled in live config by default
Fixed live config to that RAS is disabled by default

Stage testing. -Check that the config is set to Disabled – False

Note: The RAS component has been descoped as part of this release and therefore RAS in EJS should be set to false only.

<ras>
<enabled>false</enabled>
<base-uri>http://ras-vhost:8512/ras</base-uri>
<uri>
<is-alive>/isAlive</is-alive>
</uri>
<timeout>1000</timeout>
</ras>

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Skip health check
    Given an offline Ejector instance X
    and the Ejector has RAS [disabled]
    When the Ejector X is started
    Then the RAS health check will not run
  1. 2 - Skip RAS stage
    Given a running Ejector Instance X
    and the Ejector has RAS [disabled]
    and a message Y with RAS Eligible [true]
    When a message Y arrives in X
    Then the RAS stage will not run
    and the audit value submitToRasElapsedTime will be [0]
    and the audit value submitToRasRetries will be empty

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - GA store RAS eligibility in message
    Given a running GA instance
    and a message X that MSF has flagged as not eligible for RAS
    When the message X is deposited into Grid Adapter
    and the message is sent to Grid
    Then the message object will flag the message as not eligible for RAS
  1. 2 - EJS does not update RAS for messages that are ineligible
    Given a running EJS instance
    and a message X that is flagged as not eligible for RAS
    When the message X is deposited into the EJS
    Then the EJS will not call the update RAS functionality for message X
    and a [DEBUG] log will be created
• Add data to message object

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
#

  1. Health
    #
  1. 1 - Health Check Online
    Given a running Roxanne instance X
     and an offline Ejector Service instance Y
     and Y is configured to use X
    When the Ejector Service Y is started
    Then the connection to Roxanne instance X will be tested
     and the Ejector Service Y will start normally
  1. 2 - Health Check Offline
    Given an offline Roxanne instance X
     and an offline Ejector Service instance Y
     and Y is configured to use X
    When the Ejector Service Y is started
     and the connection to Roxanne instance X fails
    Then the Ejector Service bootstrap log will report that the Roxanne healthcheck was a [failure]
     and a [CRITICAL] alert will be sent
     and the Ejector Service Y will shutdown
  1. 3 - Send to Roxanne after Unified Scoring
    Given a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and a running Roxanne instance Z
    and a valid message X
    When message X has completed sending to Unified Scoring
    Then Y will attempt to send message X to Z
    and a [DEBUG] log will be created
  1. 4 - Good response from Roxanne
    Given a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and a running Roxanne instance Z
    and a valid message X
    When message X has completed sending to Z
    and a [2**] http response was returned
    Then message X will be sent for RAS processing
    and a [DEBUG] log will be created
  1. 5 - Client error response from Roxanne
    Given a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and a running Roxanne instance Z
    and a valid message X
    When message X has completed sending to Z
    and a [400] http response was returned
    Then message X will be sent for RAS processing
    and a [ERROR] log will be created
    and a [CRITICAL] alert will be sent

#

  1. Backoff
    #
  1. 6 - Non [200] response from Roxanne
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • Roxanne Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Roxanne timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a Message X
    When message X is sent to Z
    and a non [2**] or non [400] http response was returned
    Then the message will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a {DEBUG] log will be written with the retry information
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 7 - Failure first back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • Roxanne Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Roxanne timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a Message X
    When message X is sent to Z
    and Roxanne does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 8 - Failure second back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • Roxanne Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Roxanne timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X which has been tried [1] time
    When message X is sent to Z
    and Roxanne does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [1000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 9 - Failure third back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • Roxanne Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Roxanne timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X which has been tried [2] times
    When message X is sent to Z
    and Roxanne does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 10 - Failure forth back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • Roxanne Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • Roxanne timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X which has been tried [3] times
    When message X is sent to Z
    and Roxanne does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised

• Sends a message object
  • DOne after Unified Scoring but before RAS

item.title: [EJS-9] Performance Test
item.description: As an Operations Team I want a Performance Test run against the Ejector Service so I can be confident that the Ejector can run at the levels required for live
item.summary: Performance Test

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: DEV completed, as a 24 hours run looks nice and healthy.
Stats results, for monitoring the EJS internal queues during the 24Hours test.
graphs of ejection requests sent to EJS by test code
Not tested on stage.Perf done by Dev.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Realistic workload
    Given a valid test environment
    and a Ejector Service instance is up and running
    When the 4 hour test is started:
    Then [100] random requests per second should be injected including:
  • lite [80%]
  • assured [20%]
  • converted [90%]
  • unconvertible [5%]
  • hangup [5%]
  1. 2 - Results available
    Given a valid test environment
    and a Ejector Service instance is up and running
    When the 4 hour test has completed a 4 hour run
    Then the following graphs will be available:
  • injection frequency
  • times taken to inject
  • ejection frequency
  • times taken to eject
  • number of injection errors
  • number of ejection errors

item.title: [EJS-7] Eject messages to MSF
item.description: As a VMCS I want the Ejection service to Eject completed messages to MSF so that the messages can be returned to customers
item.summary: Eject messages to MSF

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This has been QA complete, however the Alerts needs to be fixed as this is not part of the deliverable with the present code.

When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
and MSF does not respond within [2000] ms
Then the message will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried

and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log — Waiting for Fix

and a [WARN] alert will be raised ----- Waiting for Fix

Testing on stage –
Use Fitnesse test on stage FrontPage. EjsAcceptanceTests.CallEjectionServiceOnMessageCompletionLiteStage

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
#

  1. HealthCheck
    #
  1. 1 - Success
    Given a properly configured Ejector Service
     and the [msf-vhost] is reachable
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then the Ejector Service will start normally
  1. 2 - Failure
    Given a properly configured Ejector Service
     and the msf-vhost is not reachable
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then an [Error] will be created in the Ejector Service bootstrap log
     and a [CRITICAL] alert will be sent to nagios
     and the Ejector Service will be shutdown

#

  1. Ejection
    #
  1. 3 - Success and then send for DB work
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
    and a Message X
    When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
    and MSF returns a valid response
    Then the message X will be deposited onto the MSF soap interface
     and message X will be sent for DPM procedures
  1. 4 - Failure first back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • MSF Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • MSF timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a Message X
    When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
    and MSF does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [500] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 5 - Failure second back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • MSF Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • MSF timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X which has been tried [1] time
    When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
    and MSF does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [1000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 6 - Failure third back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • MSF Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • MSF timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X which has been tried [2] times
    When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
    and MSF does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 7 - Failure forth back off
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • MSF Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • MSF timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X which has been tried [3] times
    When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
    and MSF does not respond within [2000] ms
    Then the message will be requeued for [2000] milliseconds and then retried
    and a [WARN] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [WARN] alert will be raised
  1. 8 - HardTAT
    Given a Ejector Service instance
    and the Ejector Service configuration contains :
  • MSF Back Off Time [500,1000,2000]
  • MSF timeout [2000] milliseconds
    and a message X Hard TAT time has already passed
    When the message X is sent for MSF Ejection
    Then the message X will be marked as [Unconvertible]
    and the converted text will be removed
     and message X will be sent for DPM procedures
    and no more attempts to send the message X to MSF will be attempted
    and the audit line will note that the message was changed to unconvertible and not ejected to MSF
    and a [ERROR] log will be written to the EJS log
    and a [ERROR] alert will be raised

item.title: [EJS-6] Apply Post Processing to converted messages
item.description: As a Product manager I want the Post Processing rules applied to all converted messages so that the converted text is properly processed
item.summary: Apply Post Processing to converted messages

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Stage testing
[gbabalola@slogejec01 ejector-service]$ tail -F ejector-service.log

012-06-26 16:03:51,243 [qtp964992431-26] [] DEBUG com.spinvox.jettyservice.filter.RequestLoggingFilter - [10.16.52.124] doPOST [/ejector/ejectMessage] --> [202]
2012-06-26 16:03:51,268 [Workflow-pool-3-Thread-30] [20120626160346-slogmsf01-28495-17] DEBUG com.nuance.v2t.ejector.workflow.task.EjectToMsfTask - Message [20120626160346-slogmsf01-28495-17] Hard TAT: [2012-06-26 16:13:46.000]
2012-06-26 16:03:51,270 [Workflow-pool-3-Thread-30] [20120626160346-slogmsf01-28495-17] DEBUG com.nuance.v2t.ejector.ejection.MessagePostProcessor - Post Processing: [20120626160346-slogmsf01-28495-17]

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Cascade rules
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
     and a post processing configuration files:
     - A : common-rules.xml
     - B : en-GB-common-rules.xml
     - C : en-GB-spinvox-rules.xml
     and a message X will language [en-GB] and carrier [spinvox]
    When a message X is sent for post processing
    Then the replacement rules for A, B and C will be applied to the message text of X
  1. 2 - Only common rules
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
     and a post processing configuration files:
     - A : common-rules.xml
     - B : en-GB-common-rules.xml
     - C : en-GB-spinvox-rules.xml
     and a message X will language [en-US] and carrier [spinvox]
    When a message X is sent for post processing
    Then only the replacement rules for A will be applied to the message text of X
  1. 3 - No rules
    Given an offline Ejector Service instance X
     and no post processing configuration files
    When the Ejector Service instance X is started
    Then a [WARN} alert will be created
     and the Ejector Service instance will start normally
  1. 4 - No rules folder
    Given an offline Ejector Service instance X
     and a post processing rules folder configuration Y
     and Y does not exist
    When the Ejector Service instance X is started
    Then a [CRITICAL} alert will be created
     and an [FATAL] log will be created
     and the Ejector Service instance will shutdown
  1. 5 - No converted text in logs
    Given a running Ejector Service instance
     and a post processing configuration files:
     - A : common-rules.xml
     - B : en-GB-common-rules.xml
     - C : en-GB-spinvox-rules.xml
     and a message X will language [en-GB] and carrier [spinvox]
    When a message X is sent for post processing
    Then the Ejector Service log will not contain any converted text for message X
     and the Ejector Service bootstrap log will not contain any converted text for message X

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
#

  1. Healthcheck
    #
  1. 1 - Happy Health Check
    Given a valid install of Ejector Service
     and a running DPM isAlive interface at [data-persistence-manager-vhost]
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then an [OK] alert will be sent to Orac for the Ejector Service Health Check service
     and a [INFO] log created saying that [DPM Health Check passed]
    and the Ejector Service will startup normally
  1. 2 - Happy Health Not Contactable
    Given a valid install of Ejector Service
     and no DPM isAlive interface at [data-persistence-manager-vhost]
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then an [CRITICAL] alert will be sent to Orac for the Ejector Service Health Check service
     and a [ERROR] log created saying that [DPM Health Check failed]
    and the Ejector Service will shutdown
  1. Old Scoring
  1. 3 - Valid Scoring request REMOVED AS THIS IS PART OF DPM

#

  1. Message Completion (Lite)
    #
  1. 4 - Message Logging Convertible (online)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Lite]
  • Conversion Status [Converted]
  • Converting Agent [Grid]
  • Offline mode [false]
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    and the Ejector Service should send a message event to the DPM with the transcriber [Grid] and the message object X
    and the DPM returns a [200] response
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing
  1. 5 - Message Logging Unconvertible (online)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Lite]
  • Conversion Status [Unconvertible]
  • Converting Agent [Grid]
  • Offline mode [false]
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    and the Ejector Service should send a message event to the DPM with the transcriber [Grid] and the message object X
    and the DPM returns a [200] response
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing
  1. 6 - Message Logging Hangup (online)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Lite]
  • Conversion Status [Hangup]
  • Converting Agent [Grid]
  • Offline mode [false]
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    and the Ejector Service should send a message event to the DPM with the transcriber [Grid] and the message object X
    and the DPM returns a [200] response
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing
  1. 7 - Message Logging (offline)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Lite]
  • Conversion Status [Converted]
  • Converting Agent [Grid]
  • Offline mode [true]
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing

#

  1. Message Completion (Assured)
    #
  1. 8 - Message Logging Convertible (online)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Assured]
  • Conversion Status [Converted]
  • Converting Agent [Agent Name]
  • Offline mode [false]
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    and the Ejector Service should send a message event to the DPM with the transcriber [Agent Name] and the message object X
    and the DPM returns a [200] response
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing
  1. 9 - Message Logging Unconvertible (online)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Assured]
  • Conversion Status [Unconvertible]
  • Converting Agent [Agent Name]
  • Offline mode [false]
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    and the Ejector Service should send a message event to the DPM with the transcriber [Agent Name] and the message object X
    and the DPM returns a [200] response
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing
  1. 10 - Message Logging Hangup (online)
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X with :
  • COS [Assured]
  • Conversion Status [Hangup]
  • Converting Agent [Agent Name]
  • Offline mode [false]
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X has been sent to MSF successfully
    and the Ejector Service should send a message event to the DPM with the transcriber [Agent Name] and the message object X
    and the DPM returns a [200] response
    Then a [DEBUG] log will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing

#

  1. Errors
    #
  1. 11 - DPM returns an error
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X
     and a running DPM Instance
     and a running and contactable DPM
    When the message X details are sent to the DPM
    and the DPM returns a non 200 response
    Then an [ERROR] log will be created
    and an [CRITICAL] alert will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing
  1. 12 - DPM not available
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
     and a message X
     and the DPM Instance is not contactable
    When the message X details are sent to the DPM
    and the DPM does not return a response
    Then an [ERROR] log will be created
    and an [CRITICAL] alert will be created
    and the message will then be sent for Unified Scoring processing

item.title: [EJS-4] Ejection request interface
item.description: As a VMCS I want the Ejection service to expose an interface to deposit outbound completed message so I can get messages out of VMCS
item.summary: Ejection request interface

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Accept valid Message object
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a valid message object Y
    and Y contains the converting agent is [Grid]
    and Y contains the local storage manager location
    and the total injection statistic counter is [0]
    When message Y is injected
    Then the http return code will be [200]
    and a [DEBUG] log will be created with some details of the message Y
    and the total injection statistic will be [1]
  1. 2 - Reject invalid message
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a message object Y
    and Y does not contain the converting agent
    and Y does not contain contains the local storage manager location
    and the total injection statistic counter is [0]
    When message Y is injected
    Then the http return code will be [400]
    and an [ERROR] log will be created in the Ejector Service log file
    and an [CRITICAL] alert will be raised
    and message Y will not be accepted
    and the total injection statistic will be [0]
  1. 3 - Route converted messages to Post Processor
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a valid message object Y
    and Y has a conversion status of [Converted]
    When message Y has been injected
    Then message Y will be sent to Post Processing
  1. 4 - Route unconvertible messages to MSF ejection
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a valid message object Y
    and Y has a conversion status of [Unconvertible]
    and the total injection statistic counter is [0]
    When message Y has been injected
    Then message Y will be sent to the MSF Ejector
    and the total injection statistic counter is [1]
  1. 5 - Route hangup messages to MSF ejection
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a valid message object Y
    and Y has a conversion status of [Hangup]
    and the total injection statistic counter is [0]
    When message Y has been injected
    Then message Y will be sent to the MSF Ejector
    and the total injection statistic counter is [1]
  1. 6 - Route Inconclusive messages to MSF ejection as Unconvertible
    Given a running Ejector Service X
    and a valid message object Y
    and Y has a conversion status of [Inconclusive]
    and the total injection statistic counter is [0]
    When message Y has been injected
    Then the conversion status of message Y will be changed to [Unconvertible]
    and message Y will be sent to the MSF Ejector
    and the total injection statistic counter is [1]

• Restful interface
  • Includes logic
  • Stats
  • Included in message object:
  • Converting Agent
  • Storage Manager Location

item.title: [EJS-3] Call Unified Scoring on message completion
item.description: As a Unified Scoring I want to be passed all messages that are ejected by VMCS so I can have them available for selection
item.summary: Call Unified Scoring on message completion

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. 1 - Health Check Online
    Given a running Unified Scoring instance X
     and an offline Ejector Service instance Y
     and Unified Scoring is enabled in the EJS configuration
     and Y is configured to use X
    When the Ejector Service Y is started
    Then the connection to Unified Scoring instance X will be tested
     and the Ejector Service Y will start normally
  1. 2 - Health Check Offline (enabled)
    Given an offline Unified Scoring instance X
     and an offline Ejector Service instance Y
     and Unified Scoring is enabled in the EJS configuration
     and Y is configured to use X
    When the Ejector Service Y is started
     and the connection to Unified Scoring instance X fails
    Then the Ejector Service bootstrap log will report that the RAS healthcheck was a [failure]
     and a [WARN] alert will be sent
     and the Ejector Service Y will start normally
  1. 3 - Health Check Offline (disabled)
    Given an offline Unified Scoring instance X
     and an offline Ejector Service instance Y
     and Unified Scoring is disabled in the EJS configuration
     and Y is configured to use X
    When the Ejector Service Y is started
    Then the Ejector Service Y will start normally
  1. 4 - Converted
    Given a running Unified Scoring instance X
     and a running Ejector Service instance Y
     and Unified Scoring is enabled in the EJS configuration
     and Y is configured to use X
     and a message Z
    When the message Z has completed MSF Ejection
    Then the message Z will be sent to X for scoring
  1. 5 - non 202 response
    Given a running Unified Scoring instance X
     and a running Ejector Service instance Y
     and Unified Scoring is enabled in the EJS configuration
     and Y is configured to use X
     and a message Z
    When the message Z has completed MSF Ejection
     and a [400] response is returned from X
    Then a [WARN] log will be created
     and a [WARN] nagios alert will be sent
     and the Audit log will note that [An error was returned when sending to scoring]
  1. 6 - US timeout
    Given a running Unified Scoring instance X
     and a running Ejector Service instance Y
     and Unified Scoring is enabled in the EJS configuration
     and Y is configured to use X
     and a message Z
     and a EJS scoring timeout config of [1000] milliseconds
    When the message Z has completed MSF Ejection
     and send the request to X takes longer than [1000] milliseconds
    Then a [WARN] log will be created
     and a [WARN] nagios alert will be sent
     and the Audit log will note that [Sending message for scoring timed out]

item.title: [EJS-2] Update RAS service on message completion
item.description: As a RAS service I want to be informed of the final outcome of all assured messages so that when a RAS message is detected I can apply the outcome
item.summary: Update RAS service on message completion

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The issue has just been emailed to: gbenga.babalola@nuance.com, jarrad.clark@nuance.com, with subject: Update RAS service on message completion and content:

Hi

I accidentally signed-off EJS-2 in JIRA, when it should have been EJS-11.

I'll taking a look at EJS-2 tomorrow, but today I've only signed of EJS-11.

I can't see an easy way of bumping it back...

A

Stage testing. -Check that the config is set to Disabled – False

gbabalola@slogejec01 ejector-service]$ less ejector-service.xml
Note: The RAS component has been descoped as part of this release and therefore RAS in EJS should be set to false only.

<ras>
<enabled>false</enabled>
<base-uri>http://ras-vhost:8512/ras</base-uri>
<uri>
<is-alive>/isAlive</is-alive>
</uri>
<timeout>1000</timeout>
</ras>

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
#

  1. Healthcheck
    #
  1. 1 - Startup health check (success)
    Given an offline Ejector Service X
    and a valid RAS server is available at Y
    and RAS is enabled in the Ejector Service configured
    and the Ejector Service is configured to use the RAS server at [Y-host:Y-port/ras/isAlive]
    When X is started
    Then the Ejector Service bootstrap log will report that the RAS healthcheck was a [success]
  1. 2 - Startup health check (failure) (RAS enabled)
    Given an offline Ejector Service X
    and no RAS server is available at Y
    and RAS is enabled in the Ejector Service configured
    and the Ejector Service is configured to use the RAS server at [Y-host:Y-port/ras/isAlive]
    When X is started
    Then the Ejector Service bootstrap log will report that the RAS healthcheck was a [failure]
    and the Ejector Service will shutdown
  1. 3 - Startup health check (failure) (RAS disabled)
    Given an offline Ejector Service X
    and no RAS server is available at Y
    and RAS is disabled in the Ejector Service configured
    and the Ejector Service is configured to use the RAS server at [Y-host:Y-port/ras/isAlive]
    When X is started
    Then the Ejector Service bootstrap log will report that the RAS healthcheck was a [success]

#

  1. Update RAS outcomes
    #
  1. 4 - Converted
    Given a running RAS Server X
    and a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and Y is configured to use X
    and a message Z
    and Z is flagged as [Converted]
    When the message has completed scoring
    Then an update request for Z will be sent to X
    and the message Z will be audited
  1. 5 - Unconvertible
    Given a running RAS Server X
    and a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and Y is configured to use X
    and a message Z
    and Z is flagged as [Unconvertible]
    When the message has completed scoring
    Then an update request for Z will be sent to X
    and the message Z will be audited
  1. 6 - Hangup
    Given a running RAS Server X
    and a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and Y is configured to use X
    and a message Z
    and Z is flagged as [hangup]
    When the message has completed scoring
    Then an update request for Z will be sent to X
    and the message Z will be audited

#

  1. Error
    #
  1. 7 - Non 202 response
    Given a running RAS Server X
    and a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and Y is configured to use X
    and a message Z
    When the message has completed scoring
    and is sent to the RAS Server X
    and a [400] response is returned from X
    Then a [WARN] log will be created
    and a [WARN] nagios alert will be sent
    and the message Z will be audited showing the details of the error
  1. 8 - US timeout
    Given a running RAS Server X
    and a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and Y is configured to use X
    and a message Z
    and a EJS RAS timeout config of [1000] milliseconds
    When the message has completed scoring
    and sending the RAS request to X takes longer than [1000] milliseconds
    Then a [WARN] log will be created
    and a [WARN] nagios alert will be sent
    and the message Z will be audited showing the details of the error
  1. 9 - Multiple errors
    Given a running RAS Server X
    and a running Ejector Service instance Y
    and Y is configured to use X
    and a message Z
    and the Unified Scoring had an Error while sending
    When the message has completed scoring
    and is sent to the RAS Server X
    and a [400] response is returned from X
    Then a [WARN] log will be created
    and a [WARN] nagios alert will be sent
    and the message Z will be audited showing the details of both the Unified Scoring and RAS errors

item.title: [EJS-1] Application Creation
item.description: As a business I want the Ejector Service application created so that the developers have a service to build upon
item.summary: Application Creation

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. init.d
  1. 1
    Given a valid Ejector Service configuration
    When the command init.d script [ejectorService start] is run from the command line
    Then ejectorService should startup
    and return the message [Started Ejector Service]
    and return an "OK" response from the isAlive command
  1. 2
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
    When the command init.d script [ejectorService stop] is run from the command line
    Then ejectorService should shutdown
    and return the message "Stopped Ejector Service"
    and a log should be created saying the ejectorService stopped
  1. 3
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
    When the command init.d script [ejectorService start] is run from the command line
    Then return the message "Ejector Service is Already Running"
  1. 4
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
    When the command init.d script [ejectorService restart] is run from the command line
    Then ejectorService should shutdown
    and return the message "Stopped Ejector Service"
    and then should start again
    and return the message "Started Ejector Service"
    and return an "OK" response from the isAlive command
  1. 5
    Given a running instance of Ejector Service
    When the command init.d script [ejectorService status] is run from the command line
    Then return the message "ejectorService started"
  1. 6
    Given a shutdown instance of Ejector Service
    When the command init.d script [ejectorService status] is run from the command line
    Then return the message "Ejector Service is Stopped"
    and a log should be created saying the ejectorService stopped
  1. Is Alive
  1. 7
    Given a working Ejector Service instance
    When the uri [ejector-service-vhost:ejector-service-port/ejectorService/isAlive] to requested
    Then the http result [200] will be returned
    and the message [OK] will be presented
  2. Health Checks
  1. Nagios / Orac
  1. 8
    Given a properly configured Ejector Service instance
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    and all health checks pass
    Then an [OK] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
    and add a log message for successful startup
  1. 9
    Given a contactable Nagios / Orac
    and all other health checks pass
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then an [OK] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
  1. Log4j configuration
  1. 10
    Given a valid Log4j configuration file
    and all other health checks pass
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then an [OK] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
  1. 11
    Given an invalid Log4j configuration file
    and a connection with Orac is available
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then a [CRITICAL] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
    and the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service will be shutdown
  1. 12 (Manual)
    Given an invalid Log4j configuration file
    and no connection with Orac is available
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
  1. 13 (Manual)
    Given an unreadable Log4j configuration file
    and a connection with Orac is available
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
    and raise a [CRITICAL] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
  1. Jetty configuration file
  1. 13
    Given a valid Jetty configuration file
    and all other health checks pass
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then an [OK] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
  1. 14
    Given an invalid Jetty configuration file
    and a connection with Orac is available
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then an [CRITICAL] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
    and the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
  1. 15 (Manual)
    Given an invalid Jetty configuration file
    and no connection with Orac is available
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
  1. 16 (Manual)
    Given an unreadable Jetty configuration file
    and a connection with Orac is available
    When the Ejector Service instance is started
    Then the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
    and raise a [CRITICAL] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
  1. Ejector Service Configuration
  1. 17
    Given a valid Ejector Service configuration file
    and all other health checks pass
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then an [OK] message will be sent to Orac on the [Startup HealthCheck] service name
  1. 18
    Given an invalid Ejector Service configuration file
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
  1. 19 (Manual)
    Given an Ejector Service configuration file which is unreadable
    When the Ejector Service is started
    Then the bootstrap log should contain details of the error
    and the Ejector Service instance will be shutdown
  1. Welcome
  1. 20 - welcome page
    Given a working Ejector Service instance
    When the uri [ejector-service-vhost:ejector-service-port/ejectorService/welcome] to requested
    Then the welcome page will be displayed showing all available interfaces

• Jetty Service
  • Healthchecks
  • Stats framework
  • RPM specs
  • Bamboo Stages
  • Welcome
  • isAlive
